"body": "Muzaffarnagar, Aug 19 (IANS) At least 13 people were killed and scores injured in a major derailment when 14 coaches of the Kalinga Utkal Express bound for Haridwar in Uttarakhand went off the tracks with one of the coaches mounting on another near Khatauli in Uttar Pradesh on Saturday evening.\n\n\"Thirteen people have died, and 58 injured people have been admitted to hospital,\" Union Minister and Muzaffarnagar MP Sanjeev Balyan told media at the accident spot.\n\nMore casualties are feared as a number of passengers are said to have been trapped in the derailed coaches. With nightfall adding to difficulties, the railways were engaged in a grim battle for rescuing those trapped by deploying heavy gas cutters and other equipments to break open into the coaches.\n\nThe accident occurred around 5.45 p.m. when 14 coaches of the Puri-Haridwar Kalinga Utkal Express bound for Haridwar derailed in Khatauli in Meerut-Saharanpur Division. The impact of the accident was so severe that one of the coaches could be seen mounted on another while another coach had crashed into a building along the tracks.\n\nRailway spokesperson Anil Saxena said that 14 of the coaches had derailed.\n\nPolice and railway officials said they were keeping all options open when asked whether there could be a terror angle in the accident.\n\nThe railways and the police summoned all equipments including heavy lift cranes and gas cutters to access the affected coaches and cut through them to bring passengers to safety.\n\nThe National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) also rushed forces to join the rescue operation.\n\nA team of the ATS of the state police has been rushed to the accident site, an official told IANS. The team headed by DSP Anoop Singh will probe any terror angle into the rail accident. NDRF teams have also been rushed to the accident site.\n\nChief Minister Yogi Adityanath spoke to principal secretary (Home) Arvind Kumar and the Muzaffarnagar district magistrate (DM) and directed them to ensure prompt rescue and relief operations at Khatauli.\n\nTwo dozen people, many women and children have been admitted to nearby medical facilities for treatment. The train had left Puri at 9 p.m. on Friday night and was to terminate at Haridwar at 9 p.m. Saturday night.\n\nRailway officials said a medical train was on way and that trains on the route have been diverted through Shamli.\n\nAdditional Superintendent of Police, Muzaffarnagar, Ajay Kumar told IANS that police teams were trying to rescue as many passengers trapped in the coaches as possible.\n\nRailways Minister Suresh Prabhu said he was personally monitoring the situation and a probe has been ordered.\n\n\"I am personally monitoring situation. Have instructed senior officers to reach site immediately and ensure speedy rescue and relief operations,\" Prabhu said in series of tweets.\n\n\"Have ordered an inquiry into the unfortunate accident to ascertain the cause. Strict action will be taken against any lapse,\" he said.\n\nThe Minister said that medical vans have been rushed to the site. All efforts are being taken to ensure speedy relief and rescue operations, he said.\n\n\"I have instructed Chairman Railway Board, Member Traffic to oversee rescue and relief operations,\" he said, adding that he has also instructed the General Manager, other senior officials to ensure all possible help to the people.\n\nThe Minister said that he was in close touch with Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, state government officials, district administration to coordinate rescue and relief operations\n\nUttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath said that rescue operation has been taken up on a war footing with railways and the state government working together.\n\n--IANS\n\nbns-aks-ps-md/vsc/rn\n\nSEARCH", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "16:22:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T16:22:00Z"}

"extractedDates": [{"amb": false, "textEnd": 18, "date": "2017-08-19", "imp": true, "textStart": 9}], "isDuplicate": false, "dateCrawl": "2017-08-19", "body": "[India], August 19 (ANI): Following the derailment of at least five coaches of the Puri-Haridwar-Kalinga Utkal Express in Muzaffarnagar on Saturday, Union Railway Minister Suresh Prabhu has assured that he is personally monitoring the situation and has ordered enquiry on the same.\n\nPrabhu took to Twitter to share information on the same and posted, \"Have ordered inquiry into the unfortunate accident to ascertain the cause. Strict action will be taken against any lapse\"\n\n\"I am personally monitoring situation. Hv instructed senior officers to reach site immediately and ensure speedy rescue and relief operations.\"\n\nHe also informed, \"In close touch with @CMOfficeUP , State Government officials,district administration to coordinate rescue and relief operations.\"\n\n\"Medical vans have been rushed to the site. All efforts being taken to ensure speedy relief and rescue operations,\" he further tweeted.\n\n\"Have instructed Chairman Rly Board,Member Traffic to oversee rescue and relief operations.I am personally monitoring situation.\"\n\nUttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath too took to Twitter to express his grief over the incident and said that the victims will be given proper treatment and orders for rescue and relief operations have been passed.\n\nFormer Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Akhilesh Yadav too took to Twitter to share his empathy with the families of the victims.\n\nFive coaches of Puri-Haridwar-Kalinga Utkal Express have been derailed in Muzaffarnagar's Khatauli area here today, leading to scores of injured passengers.\n\nThe incident took place around 6:00 pm in the evening.\n\nAccording to the Indian Railways, at least 15 to 20 people have been injured in this incident, while casualties are expected.\n\nAnil Saxena, spokesperson of Indian Railways told ANI, \"There is no authentic information on the casualties right now. We are trying our best to mobilize resources for the rescue and relief operations.\"\n\nMeanwhile Neeraj Sharma, CPRO, Northern Railways, said, \"As per reports, there are injuries to a few passengers. Muzaffarnagar DM is about to reach the train derailment site.\"\n\nA team of National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) has been mobilised for the rescue operation at Muzaffarnagar's Khatauli railway station. "sify.com", "id": "186", "title": "Sify"}, "lang": "eng", "date": "2017-08-19", "title": "23 dead, 40 injured as 14 coaches derail in Uttar Pradesh (Intro Roundup)", "storyUri": "eng-3374117", "extractedDates": [{"amb": false, "textEnd": 21, "date": "2017-08-19", "imp": true, "textStart": 15}], "isDuplicate": false, "dateCrawl": "2017-08-19", "body": "Muzaffarnagar, Aug 19 (IANS) At least 23 people were killed and at least 40 injured in a major derailment when 14 coaches of the Kalinga Utkal Express bound for Haridwar in Uttarakhand went off the tracks with one of the coaches mounting on another near Khatauli in Uttar Pradesh on Saturday evening.\n\nMore casualties are feared as a number of passengers are said to have been trapped in the derailed coaches. Union Minister and Muzaffarnagar MP Sanjay Balyan, who reached the spot, claimed nearly 60 people were injured.\n\nThe state police however put the dead at 23 and injured at 40.\n\n\"Twentythree people have died, and 40 are injured,\" the office of the Director General of Police office said in a revised release. The earlier release it issued had put the number of injured at 400.\n\nWith nightfall adding to difficulties, the railways were engaged in a grim battle for rescuing those trapped by deploying heavy gas cutters and other equipments to break open into the coaches.\n\nThe accident occurred around 5.45 p.m. when 14 coaches of the Puri-Haridwar Kalinga Utkal Express bound for Haridwar derailed in Khatauli in Meerut-Saharanpur Division. The impact of the accident was so severe that one of the coaches could be seen mounted on another while another coach had crashed into the Chowdhary Tilakram Inter College along the tracks.\n\nRailway spokesperson Anil Saxena said that 14 of the coaches had derailed, while the state police chief's press release said eight coaches had derailed.\n\nPolice and railway officials said they were keeping all options open when asked whether there could be a terror angle in the accident.\n\nThe railways and police summoned all equipments including heavy lift cranes and gas cutters to access the affected coaches and cut through them to bring passengers to safety.\n\nThe National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) also rushed forces to join the rescue operation. Its chief Sanjay Kumar said 20 bodies have been recovered so far.\n\nA team of the ATS of the state police has been rushed to the accident site, an official told IANS. The team headed by DSP Anoop Singh will probe any terror angle into the rail accident.\n\nChief Minister Yogi Adityanath directed Principal Secretary, Home, Arvind Kumar and the Muzaffarnagar District Magistrate to ensure prompt rescue and relief operations at Khatauli. He also deputed two ministers - Satish Mahana and Suresh Rana - to rush to the accident site to oversee the rescue and relief operations.\n\nHe also announced an ex-gratia of Rs 2 lakh each for the dead, Rs 50,000 to this injured.\n\nTwo dozen people, many women and children have been admitted to nearby medical facilities for treatment. The train had left Puri at 9 p.m. on Friday night and was to terminate at Haridwar at 9 p.m. Saturday night.\n\nRailway officials said a medical train was on way and that trains on the route have been diverted through Shamli.\n\nAdditional Superintendent of Police, Muzaffarnagar, Ajay Kumar told IANS that police teams were trying to rescue as many passengers trapped in the coaches as possible.\n\nRailways Minister Suresh Prabhu announced an ex-gratia of Rs 3.5 lakh each to the kin of those who lost their lives and Rs 50,000 each for those seriously injured. He also announced Rs 25,000 for passengers with minor injuries.\n\nHe said he was personally monitoring the situation and a probe has been ordered.\n\n\"I am personally monitoring situation. Have instructed senior officers to reach site immediately and ensure speedy rescue and relief operations,\" Prabhu said in series of tweets.\n\n\"Have ordered an inquiry into the unfortunate accident to ascertain the cause. Strict action will be taken against any lapse,\" he said.\n\nThe Minister said that medical vans have been rushed to the site. All efforts are being taken to ensure speedy relief and rescue operations, he said.\n\n\"I have instructed Chairman Railway Board, Member Traffic to oversee rescue and relief operations,\" he said, adding that he has also instructed the General Manager, other senior officials to ensure all possible help to the people.\n\nThe Minister said that he was in close touch with the Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister and state government officials, district administration to coordinate rescue and relief operations\n\nAdityanath said that rescue operation has been taken up on a war footing with railways and the state government working together.\n\nPresident Ram Nath Kovind, Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Congress President Sonia Gandhi and party Vice President Rahul Gandhi have condoled the deaths and expressed sympathies for the families of those who lost their lives.\n\nCongress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala took a dig at the Modi government over rail safety, saying that 259 passengers have lost their lives in 27 rail accidents in the last three years.\n\n\"When will government wake up?\" he asked.\n\n--IANS\n\nbns-aks-ps-md-vd\n\nSEARCH", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "18:07:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T18:07:00Z"}

Muzaffarnagar.\n\nReflecting on the incident, India's Union Railway Minister Suresh Prabhu said he was personally monitoring the situation and that he has directed senior officials to take stock of "id": "1440882", "score": 4}], "source": {"uri": "sify.com", "id": "186", "title": "Sify"}, "lang": "eng", "date": "2017-08-19", "title": "Muzaffarnagar train derailment: Yogi Adityanath sends two ministers to take stock", "storyUri": "eng-3374117", "extractedDates": [{"amb": false, "textEnd": 15, "date": "2017-08-19", "imp": true, "textStart": 9}], "isDuplicate": false, "dateCrawl": "2017-08-19", "body": "[India], Aug 19 (ANI): Terming the derailment of 14 coaches of the Puri-Haridwar-Kalinga Utkal Express which took place near Khatauli railway station in Muzaffarnagar, Uttar Pradesh as 'unfortunate', Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Saturday said that he has sent two of his ministers to the accident spot to take a stock of the situation.\n\n\"Two of the ministers of the Uttar Pradesh Government, Satish Mahana and Suresh Kumar Rana have been sent to the accident spot. I empathise with the family of the injured and killed,\" the Chief Minister said.\n\nHe further informed that the Uttar Pradesh Administration is in touch with the Railway Ministry and will provide all necessary help needed for relief and rescue operation.\n\n\"I have also talked to District Magistrate and instructed for all possible relief to affected people. Hospitals have been instructed to provide free treatment to injured passengers,\" he said.\n\nHere are the updates so far:\n\n- Fourteen coaches of Puri-Haridwar-Kalinga Utkal Express derailed in Muzaffarnagar's Khatauli area\n\n- 10 people have lost their lives till now and over 30 is said to be injured.\n\n- The incident took place around 5:50 pm.\n\n- Indian Railways release emergency helpline number for detail information.\n\n- Nine Uttar Pradesh Provincial Armed Constabulary (PAC) companies, a team of National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) and Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) have been rushed to the spot.\n\n- Medical vans have been rushed to the site.\n\n- Union Railway Minister Suresh Prabhu said that he has ordered inquiry into the unfortunate accident to ascertain the cause.\n\n- Railway Ministry and Uttar Pradesh Government are working hand in hand, informs Prabhu.\n\n- According to the Indian Railways, at least 15 to 20 people have been injured in this incident, while four casualties are reported as of now.\n\n- MoS Railways Manoj Sinha and BJP leader Sanjeev Balyan are at the site.\n\n- Alternate arrangement is being made for stranded passengers.\n\n-Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik announced ex gratia of Rs 5 lakhs to the next kin of any Odia passengers killed in the incident. He also announced relief of Rs 50,000 for injured.\n\n- Union Minister of Railway Suresh Prabhu announced ex gratia of Rs 3.5 lakh for the next kin of those lost their lives in the Muzaffarnagar tragedy and Rs. 50, 000 for those seriously injured and Rs. 25, 000 for people with minor injuries.\n\n- Former chief minister of Uttar Pradesh Mulayam Singh Yadav and Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Raman Singh expressed condolences to the grieving kin of the victim. the town of Khatauli whilst the Kalinga-Utkal Express was travelling from the eastern city of Puri to Haridwar city in the north of the country.\n\nThe local administration is carrying out rescue operations and a team from the National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) have been at the scene.\n\nRailways spokesman Anil Saxena said he could not confirm the number of casualties but said at least five carriages derailed.\n\nTelevision footage showed several mangled carriages piled up on each other while people looked for wounded in a crowd of people as night fell.\n\n\"We have mobilized all our resources to provide the best relief and rescue operations at this time,\" Saxena told TV channels.\n\nA police official earlier said 20 people had been injured but did not mention any people killed.\n\n\"There are certainly casualties but right now the focus is on evacuation,\" senior police officer Jitender Kumar told AFP by phone from the accident site.\n\n\"We are shifting everyone to the hospital. We are trying to take out those trapped inside the coaches.\"\n\nPhotographs from the scene showed people climbing onto upended carriages to try to pull passengers out.\n\nThe accident is the latest disaster to hit India's most populous state and comes just a week after dozens of children died at a hospital that had run out of oxygen.\n\nIndia's state railways, built during British colonial rule, have an appalling safety record after decades of low investment and have prioritized keeping fares low for the 23 million passengers who use the network every day.\n\nLess than a year ago 146 people died in a similar disaster in Uttar Pradesh.\n\nA 2012 government report said almost 15,000 people were killed every year on India's railways and described the loss of life as an annual \"massacre\".\n\nIndia recorded 27,581 railway deaths in 2014, the most recent year for which figures are available, with most victims falling from, or being struck by, moving trains.\n\nPrime Minister Narendra Modi's government has pledged to invest $137 billion over five years to modernize the crumbling railways, making them safer, faster and more efficient.", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "17:37:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T17:37:00Z"}

"extractedDates": null, "isDuplicate": false, "dateCrawl": "2017-08-19", "body": "At least 20 people have been killed and scores more injured after a train came off the tracks in India on Saturday.\n\nRescuers and local people in the northern state of Uttar Pradesh worked into the night searching for survivors in the overturned and mangled carriages. Officials have said they expect the death toll to rise.\n\nAt least eight carriages derailed at roughly 5.46pm local time, about 80 miles (130km) north of the capital New Delhi, as the train travelled towards the Hindu holy city of Haridwar, police said.\n\nTrain crashes are frequent in India, which has the world's fourth biggest rail network. Poor investment in the vast network and rising demand has left overcrowded trains running on creaking infrastructure.\n\nSaturday's accident is at least the fourth major passenger train derailment this year and the third in Uttar Pradesh in 2017. A crash in the region in November killed 150 people.\n\nA senior police officer in the state, Anand Kumar, said 20 people had been killed and more than 80 injured.\n\nSanjeev Balyan, a lawmaker from Muzaffarnagar, the city nearest to the crash, had earlier told Reuters that at least 14 people had been killed.\n\nAjay Pandey, a senior police officer at the site, said: \"We are struggling to pull out injured, and are waiting for gas cutters to arrive. It's too dark to launch a full fledged search operation, but our teams are trying their best.\"\n\nThe national authorities have dispatched disaster teams to help.\n\nIndia's prime minister, Narendra Modi, sent a message on Twitter saying he was pained by the derailment of the Utkal Express, offering condolences to families of those killed and wishing a speedy recovery to the injured.\n\nThe network is in the middle of a $130bn, five-year modernisation. The government launched the additional safety overhaul programme in February after a surge in train accidents in the past two years was blamed on defective tracks.\n\nA senior official in the Uttar Pradesh government, Arvind Kumar, told the Hindustan Times the train driver had slammed the brakes on after spotting maintenance work on the tracks that was not properly signalled.\n\nAnil Saxena, a spokesman for the railways, said it was too early to speculate about any potential cause of Saturday's crash.", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "19:59:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T19:50:00Z"}

59, "date": "2017-08-19", "freq": 3, "textStart": 44}], "isDuplicate": false, "dateCrawl": "2017-08-19", "body": "By: Express Web Desk | New Delhi | Updated: August 19, 2017 8:55 pm Coaches of the Puri-Haridwar Utkal Express train after it derailed in Khatauli near Muzaffarnagar on Saturday. Coaches of the train have derailed and at least 15 to 20 people injured as per initial reports. PTI Photo One Kanwaria killed, 4 injured in two separate accidents in MuzaffarnagarEight injured in clash over alleged eve-teasing in MuzaffarnagarTension in village in Muzaffarnagar after man killed in clash\n\nIn yet another train accident, at least ten people were killed and over 50 others were injured as six coaches of the Puri-Haridwar Kalinga Utkal Express derailed in Muzaffarnagar's Khatauli region in Uttar Pradesh on Saturday evening. Confirming the casualties to ANI, ADG Law and Order, Anand Kumar said, \"10 killed in Muzaffarnagar train derailment..More than 50 injured. ATS sent there as precautionary measure, no confirmation of terrorism angle.\" The Railway Minister has announced an ex gratia of 3.5 Lakh for those who lost their lives, 50 thousand for the seriously injured and 25 thousand ex gratia for people with minor injuries.\n\nThe accident took place around 5:45 pm and immediately after the mishap, NDRF and UP ATS teams have been dispatched to extend help in relief and rescue operations. Ambulances have also been deployed at the site of the Muzaffarnagar train derailment. According to PTI, television visuals showed derailed coaches have crashed into a house.\n\nUnion Railway Minister Suresh Prabhu assured personal monitoring of the situation and instructed senior officers to reach the site of the accident. He said that we would ensure speedy rescue operations. Prabhu tweeted that MoS for Railways, Manoj Sinha will visit the accident site with seniors officers. Prabhu added he has ordered an inquiry to ascertain the cause and warned that strict action will be taken against any lapse. Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has directed all possible help. He said, \"Sad incident, injured passengers will be given complete treatment. Directions issued for all possible assistance...we are in constant touch with the Rail Ministry.\"\n\nAmbulances have also been despatched at the site of the train derailment. (Source: ANI photo)\n\nPrime Minister Narendra Modi took to Twitter to express his grief over the accident. He said, \"Extremely pained by the derailment of the Utkal Express in Muzaffarnagar. My thoughts are with the families of the deceased. I wish those injured a speedy recovery. The situation is being monitored very closely by the Railways Ministry. Railways Ministry & UP Government are doing everything possible & providing all assistance required in the wake of the train derailment.\" President Kovind said, \"Sad at train derailment in UP; my thoughts are with deceased & their families. Injured are being rescued & provided relief.\"\n\n#WATCH: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath speaks to ANI on #Muzaffarnagar train derailment pic.twitter.com/txefkWoyAf\n\n-- ANI UP (@ANINewsUP) August 19, 2017\n\nThe Indian Railways released the emergency helpline number for detail information.\n\n#Muzaffarnagar train derailment: Indian Railways release emergency helpline number for detail information. pic.twitter.com/r1nV1Y0r6l\n\n-- ANI UP (@ANINewsUP) August 19, 2017\n\nReacting to the incident RJD leader Lalu Prasad Yadav said, \"How will people travel, there is guarantee of safety. Railway Minister should resign.\"\n\nLocal administration officials have reached the spot and rescue operations are underway, officials in Delhi said. The derailment is likely to affect the movement of trains on the busy Northern Railway route.\n\nFor all the latest India News, download Indian Express App\n\nTags: Muzaffarnagar", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "15:34:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T15:34:00Z"}

"extractedDates": [{"amb": false, "textEnd": 15, "date": "2017-08-19", "imp": true, "textStart": 9}], "isDuplicate": false, "dateCrawl": "2017-08-19", "body": "[India], Aug 19 (ANI): President Ram Nath Kovind and Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday expressed condolences to the grieving kin of the victims who lost their lives in the derailment of the Puri-Haridwar-Kalinga Utkal Express, which took place near Khatauli railway station in Muzaffarnagar.\n\n\"Sad at train derailment in UP; my thoughts are with deceased & their families. Injured are being rescued & provided relief #PresidentKovind,\" President Kovind tweeted.\n\nTalking to his Twitter handle Prime Minister Modi also expressed the pain and asserted that the situation is being closely monitored by the Indian Railway.\n\n\"Extremely pained by the derailment of the Utkal Express in Muzaffarnagar. My thoughts are with the families of the deceased,\" the Prime Minister tweeted.\n\n\"I wish those injured a speedy recovery. The situation is being monitored very closely by the Railways Ministry,\" he added.\n\nHe further said that the Indian Railways and Uttar Pradesh Government are working closely to provide relief and rescue operation\n\n\"Railways Ministry & UP Government are doing everything possible & providing all assistance required in the wake of the train derailment,\" he tweeted.\n\nCongress vice president Rahul Gandhi also took to his Twitter handle to express shock over the incident.\n\n\"Shocked to know about the unfortunate accident of Utkal Express in Muzaffarnagar. My thoughts with the families who lost their loved ones,\" Gandhi tweeted.\n\nHere are the updates so far:\n\n- Fourteen coaches of Puri-Haridwar-Kalinga Utkal Express derailed in Muzaffarnagar's Khatauli area\n\n- 10 people have lost their lives till now and over 30 are said to be injured.\n\n- The incident took place around 5:50 pm.\n\n- Indian Railways released emergency helpline number for detail information.\n\n- Nine Uttar Pradesh Provincial Armed Constabulary (PAC) companies, a team of National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) and Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) have been rushed to the spot.\n\n- Medical vans have also been rushed to the site\n\n- Union Railway Minister Suresh Prabhu said that he has ordered inquiry into the unfortunate accident to ascertain the cause.\n\n- Railway Ministry and Uttar Pradesh Government are working hand in hand, informs Prabhu.\n\n- As per sources repair work was underway at the track.\n\n- MoS Railways Manoj Sinha and BJP leader Sanjeev Balyan are at the site.\n\n- Alternate arrangement is being made for stranded passengers.\n\n-Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik announced ex gratia of Rs 5 lakhs to the next kin of any Odia passengers killed in the incident. He also announced relief of Rs 50,000 for injured.\n\n- Union Minister of Railway Suresh Prabhu announced ex gratia of Rs 3.5 lakh for the next kin, Rs. 50, 000 for those seriously injured and Rs. 25, 000 for people with minor injuries.\n\n- Former chief minister of Uttar Pradesh Mulayam Singh Yadav and Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Raman Singh expressed condolences to the grieving kin of the victim. 1006}], "isDuplicate": false, "dateCrawl": "2017-08-19", "body": "New Delhi: Highlights14 coaches of Utkal Express derail near Khautali, about 100km from Delhi Train was headed from Puri in Odisha to Haridwar in Uttarakhand The accident took place around 5.46 p.m in Khautali in Muzaffarnagar At least 23 people have died and over 40 injured after 14 coaches of the Puri-Haridwar Utkal Express derailed in Uttar Pradesh this evening.\n\nThe accident took place around 5.46 pm in Khatauli in Muzaffarnagar, barely 100 kilometres from the national capital, New Delhi. The train was headed from Puri in Odisha to Haridwar in Uttarakhand. One coach rammed into a house on the sides of the tracks and two coaches climbed one over the other.\n\nRailway Minister Suresh Prabhu has ordered an inquiry into the train derailment to ascertain its cause. \"Strict action will be taken against any lapse,\" the minister tweeted.\n\nIn close touch with @CMOfficeUP , State Government officials,district administration to coordinate rescue and relief operations- Suresh Prabhu (@sureshpprabhu)\n\nAugust 19, 2017\n\nA team of the ATS of the police has been rushed to the accident site to conduct a preliminary inquiry. The team headed by DSP Anoop Singh will probe any terror angle into the rail accident. NDRF teams have also been rushed to the accident site. Authorities, however, maintain there has been nothing to suggest foul play in the accident.\n\nChief Minister Yogi Adityanath spoke to principal secretary (Home) Arvind Kumar and the Muzaffarnagar district magistrate (DM) and directed them to ensure prompt rescue and relief operations at Khatauli.\n\nForty people, many women and children have been admitted to nearby medical hospitals for treatment. The train had left Puri at 9 pm on Friday night and was to terminate at Haridwar at 9 pm. Cutters and cranes have been requisitioned to cut the mangled remains of the coaches and rescue people from inside.\n\nLocal residents of Khatauli town were the first ones to reach the passengers and pulled out the ones they could. A 40-year-old woman, one of the many rescued by residents, said she had occupied an upper berth. \"There was a loud noise,\" she said. The screams and cries for help followed. \"I still can't find my aunt,\" the woman, in her late thirties said.\n\nThe incident took place in Khatauli in Muzaffarnagar, barely 100 kilometres from the national capital, New Delhi\n\nPrime Minister Narendra Modi tweeted to express their condolences for the families of those killed.\n\nRailways Ministry & UP Government are doing everything possible & providing all assistance required in the wake of the train derailment: PM- PMO India (@PMOIndia)\n\nAugust 19, 2017First NDRF team with 44 rescuers and 2 search dogs have been sent to the accident site.\n\n#WATCH: Visuals from the train derailment site in Muzaffarnagar's Khatauli; 6 coaches have derailed. More details awaited #UttarPradeshpic.twitter.com/AiNdfKV7oS- ANI UP (@ANINewsUP)\n\nAugust 19, 2017\n\nLocal administration officials have reached the spot and rescue operations are underway, officials in Delhi said. Sub-Divisional Magistrate told NDTV that about 50 people have been rescued so far.\n\nNDRF teams mobilised for rescue operation at Khatauli railway station,Muzaffarnagr, U.P. where train accident took place.- NDRF (@NDRFHQ)\n\nAugust 19, 2017\n\nThe derailment is likely to affect movement of trains on the busy Northern Railway route. The Railways has announced a compensation of Rs. 3.5 lakh for the family of those killed, Rs. 50,000 for those seriously injured and Rs. 25,000 for people with minor injuries.\n\n#UtkalExpress \u092e\u0941\u091c\u093c\u092b\u094d\u092b\u0930\u0928\u0917\u0930 \u091f\u094d\u0930\u0947\u0928 \u090f\u0915\u094d\u0938\u0940\u0921\u0947\u0902\u091f \u0939\u0947\u0932\u094d\u092a \u0932\u093e\u0907\u0928 \u0928\u0902\u092c\u0930 #uppolicepic.twitter.com/9OoKSy6a7s- UP POLICE (@Uppolice)\n\nAugust 19, 2017\n\nThe accident comes less than a year after the Indore-Patna Express derailed near Kanpur in Uttar Pradesh in November last year, leaving over 100 dead.", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "16:57:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T16:57:00Z"}

"2017-08-19", "title": "23 Dead, 60 Injured as Utkal Express Derails in UP's Muzaffarnagar", "storyUri": "eng-3374117", "extractedDates": [{"amb": false, "textEnd": 3090, "date": "2017-01-", "textStart": 3078}], "isDuplicate": false, "dateCrawl": "2017-08-19", "body": "Khatauli (UP): At least 23 passengers lost their lives and over 60 sustained injuries on Saturday evening when 14 coaches of the Utkal Express, which runs on the Puri-Haridwar-Kalinga route, derailed at Khatauli in Muzaffarnagar, Uttar Pradesh. Several travellers are still feared trapped in the wreckage.\n\nThe images showed a number of mangled bogies, one of which crashed into a nearby house. The damaged coaches were S1 to S10 sleeper class, third AC B1, second AC A1 coach and the pantry. The train was coming from Puri in Odisha and going to Haridwar in Uttarakhand, normally a journey of about 36 hours.\n\nThe incident occurred at around 5:50 in the evening. The locals were the first to reach the spot and extricate trapped passengers from the train. Heavyweight cranes and gas cutters were being used and locals were seen helping out those engaged in rescue work.\n\nThe National Disaster Response Force and Uttar Pradesh's Anti-terror Squad (ATS) rushed to the accident site. The ATS suspects foul play. Uttar Pradesh ADG (Law and Order) Anand Kumar said that top priority was being accorded to ensure prompt rescue and relief work. Kumar, however, refused to comment on the reason behind the derailment, saying, \"He was not in a position to ascertain the same as of now.\"\n\nUttar Pradesh deputy chief minister Dinesh Sharma told CNN-News18 that it was a sad incident. \"I cannot say anything about the number of deaths and injuries until all the facts are on the table.\" Railways rescue workers are busy working, and ensuring that those injured in the accident are brought to hospitals, he said.\n\nThe rescue operation hit a roadblock after the darkness set in. \"The government has ensured proper lighting facilities at the spot. The administration is currently in touch with local authorities, too,\" Sharma said.\n\nUnion Health Minister JP Nadda, keeping the gravity of the situation in mind, asked the Central Trauma Care teams to remain on standby as they can be put into service anytime.\n\nPrime Minister Narendra Modi expressed extreme pain over the Utkal Express derailment and said the Railway Ministry and the state government were doing everything possible and providing all assistance required.\n\nHe said the situation was being monitored very closely by the Railways Ministry.\n\nRailway Minister Suresh Prabhu ordered an inquiry into the derailment. He said he was personally monitoring the situation and strict action will be taken in case of any lapse. Prabhu also announced Rs 3.5 lakh exgratia for those who lost their lives, Rs 50,000 for the seriously injured and Rs 25,000 for those who received minor injuries.\n\nUttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath announced Rs 2 lakh compensation for the kin of those killed and Rs 50,000 for the injured. Odisha chief minister Naveen Patnaik has also announced Rs 5 lakh exgratia to the kin of any Odia passenger dead in Utkal Express derailment. He also asked two of his ministers to reach the site and expedite rescue and relief operations.\n\nThe train tragedy in Muzaffarnagar is the second major of the year. In January 2017, nine coaches and one diesel engine of the 18448 Jagdalpur-Bhubaneswar Hirakhand Express derailed in Vizianagaram district of Andhra Pradesh. Forty-one people had died and 68 had suffered injuries.", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "17:37:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T17:37:00Z"}

The accident claimed the lives of at least 23 people and more than 400 people were injured. Expressing grief over the incident, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said, \"Extremely pained by the derailment of the Utkal Express in Muzaffarnagar. My thoughts are with the families of the deceased.\" The prime minister also assured that the Railways Ministry and Uttar Pradesh Government are doing \"everything possible\" and providing all assistance required. Prabhu has announced ex gratia of Rs 3.5 Lakh for those who lost their lives and Rs 50 thousand for seriously injured. A sum of Rs 25 thousand will be given to the minor injured. MoS Railways Manoj Sinha has rushed to the derailment site and the rescue operations are on. Here's how the political leaders have reacted to this unfortunate incident:\n\n1. Pradesh government has informed the ministry about 12 deaths and 23 people being injured.\n\nChief Medical Officer P S Mishra and ADG (Meerut Zone) Prashant Kumar said at least 11 people were dead and 60 wounded in the accident that took place around 5.45 pm.\n\nKhatauli is around 40 km from Muzaffarnagar. PAC, ATS and NDRF teams have been rushed to the spot. Heavyweight cranes and gas cutters were being used and locals were seen helping out those engaged in rescue work\n\nMuzaffarnagar authorities have set up a control room to assist families of those affected.\n\nThe numbers are: 0131-2436918, 0131-2436103 and 0131- 2436564.\n\nPrime Minister Narendra Modi expressed extreme pain over the derailment and said the Railway Ministry and the state government were doing everything possible and providing all assistance required.\n\nHe said the situation was being monitored very closely by the Railways Ministry.\n\nRailway Minister Suresh Prabhu ordered an inquiry into the derailment. He said he was personally monitoring the situation and strict action will be taken in case of any lapse.\n\nPrabhu also announced Rs 3.5 lakh ex-gratia for those who lost their lives, Rs 50,000 for the seriously injured and Rs 25,000 for those who received minor injuries.\n\nIn a series of tweets, Prabhu said that Minister of State Manoj Sinha has rushed to the spot while the Chairman of Railway Board and Member Traffic have been asked to oversee rescue and relief operations.\n\nTwo National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) teams, comprising 45 personnel each, and two canines have been mobilised to the accident site from their base in Ghaziabad.\n\nMedical vans have also been rushed to the site.\n\n\"All efforts being taken to ensure speedy relief and rescue operations,\" Prabhu said.\n\nThe Railway Ministry was also in close touch with the Uttar Pradesh government to coordinate rescue and relief operations.\n\nIn Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh ADG (Law and Order) Anand Kumar said that top priority was being accorded to ensure prompt rescue and relief work.\n\nMeanwhile, Saxena said, \"Initially, we thought that it was only 4-5 coaches, now we have ascertained that 14 coaches have derailed. As of now our focus is on rescue and not on finding reasons for the accident.\"\n\nSince darkness was impeding rescue operations, he said the power department officials had been directed to ensure that there was no shortage of electricity.\n\nKumar also said IMA chapters in Meerut zone have been alerted and asked to ensure adequate and prompt medical care to the injured.\n\nUttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath enquired about the accident and directed officials to take all possible action, an official spokesperson said.\n\nAdityanath has directed two of his ministers to reach the site to expedite rescue and relief operations.\n\n(This article has not been edited by DNA's editorial team and is auto-generated from an agency feed.)", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "16:57:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T16:57:00Z"}

"Train derails in India, at least 14 killed, dozens injured", "storyUri": "eng-3374309", "extractedDates": null, "isDuplicate": false, "dateCrawl": "2017-08-19", "body": "NEW DELHI -- A train came off the tracks in India's northern state of Uttar Pradesh on Saturday, killing at least 14 people and wounding dozens more as carriages slammed into each other, a local official said.\n\nLocal residents told the channel that some derailed carriages hit nearby houses.\n\nTrain crashes are frequent in India, which has the world's fourth biggest rail network. Poor investment in past decades in the vast network and rising demand means overcrowded trains are running on creaking infrastructure.\n\nSaturday's accident is at least the fourth major passenger train derailment this year and the third in Uttar Pradesh in 2017. A crash in November in Uttar Pradesh killed 150 people.\n\nSanjeev Balyan, a Muzaffarnagar lawmaker, told Reuters at least 14 people had been killed and 58 seriously injured, after a local medical officer had previously put the death toll at 11.\n\nLocal television channels showed chaotic scenes at the crash site, with rescuers trying find the injured amid crowds of people gathered around overturned carriages. At least five carriages had come off the tracks.\n\n\"We are struggling to pull out injured, and are waiting for gas cutters to arrive. It's too dark to launch a full fledged search operation, but our teams are trying their best,\" said Ajay Pandey, a senior police officer at the site.\n\nThe national authorities have sent disaster teams to help.\n\nIndian Prime Minister Narendra Modi sent a message on Twitter saying he was pained by the derailment of the Utkal Express, offering condolences to families of those killed and wishing a speedy recovery to the injured.\n\nIn June, Reuters reported that a planned $15 billion safety overhaul of India's rail network was facing delays as the state steel company could not meet demand for new rails.\n\nThe network is in the middle of a $130 billion, five-year modernization. The government launched the additional safety overhaul program in February to tackle a surge in train accidents in the past two years blamed on defective tracks.", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "18:38:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T18:38:00Z"}

Muzaffarnagar", "storyUri": "eng-3374117", "extractedDates": null, "isDuplicate": false, "dateCrawl": "2017-08-19", "body": "LUCKNOW: As many as 20 persons were feared dead and scores were injured in a major train accident as 10 coaches of Puri-Haridwar Utkal Express (18477) derailed near Khatauli railway station under Kotwali police station of Muzaffarnagar district on Saturday evening.\n\nThe mishap took place at the Meerut-Saharanpur section of Delhi division of Northern railway. Sources said some of the coaches crashed into nearby houses causing major damage to public and property.\n\nThe Express train, coming from Puri, was expected to reach Haridwar at 9 pm.\n\nChief Medical Officer P S Mishra and ADG (Meerut Zone) Prashant Kumar said at least 11 people were dead and 60 wounded in the accident that took place around 5.45 pm.\n\nKhatauli is around 40 km from Muzaffarnagar. PAC, ATS and NDRF teams have been rushed to the spot. Heavyweight cranes and gas cutters were being used and locals were seen helping out those engaged in rescue work\n\nTop police and district administrative officers, including Muzaffarnagar SSP and the district magistrate (DM) were already present on the spot. Even senior officers from National Capital Region (NCR), ambulances and doctors were also rushed to the site of the accident.\n\nRescue operations are underway and hospitals of Muzaffarnagar and adjoining districts were kept on high alert to attend to the injured with promptness and give them proper medical aid.\n\nThough no official word on the reason for the mishap was out, a team of UP ATS officials left for Muzaffarnagar to look into the cause of the major mishap.\n\nRailway Minister Suresh Prabhu ordered an inquiry into the derailment. He said he was personally monitoring the situation and strict action will be taken in case of any lapse.\n\nIn a series of tweets, Prabhu also said that Minister of State Manoj Sinha has rushed to the spot while the Chairman of Railway Board and Member Traffic have been asked to oversee rescue and relief operations.\n\n\"All efforts being taken to ensure speedy relief and rescue operations,\" Prabhu said.\n\nHe also announced Rs 3.5 lakh ex-gratia for those who lost their lives, Rs 50,000 for the seriously injured and Rs 25,000 for those who received minor injuries\n\nPrime Minister Narendra Modi expressed extreme pain over the derailment and said the Railway Ministry and the state government were doing everything possible and providing all assistance required.\n\nHe said the situation was being monitored very closely by the Railways Ministry.\n\nRescue operations are underway and hospitals of Muzaffarnagar and adjoining districts were kept on high alert to attend to the injured with promptness and give them proper medical aid.\n\nThe Railway Ministry was also in close touch with the Uttar Pradesh government to coordinate rescue and relief operations.\n\nWhile Meerut-based additional deputy general (DG) railway had rushed to the spot, ADG (Law and Order) Anand Kumar said that rescue and relief were the priority and Indian Medical Association (IMA) was also approached by the state government to mobilise hospitals and doctors of the region to attend the injured passengers.\n\nNDRF teams from Delhi were also sent to the spot to join the relief and rescue operation.\n\nUttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath enquired about the accident and directed officials to take all possible action, an official spokesperson said.\n\nAdityanath has directed two of his ministers to reach the site to expedite rescue and relief operations.\n\nHaridwar railway administration has released two helpline numbers: 9760534054,5101\n\nMuzaffarnagar authorities too have Retail opens two new stores in Uttar Pradesh and Madhya Pradesh Kovind to launch campaign from Uttar Pradesh on June 25 7th Junior Women's Hockey C'ship: Uttar Pradesh thrash Mumbai 7-1 7th Sub Junior National Hockey C'ship: Uttar Pradesh beat Bihar 5-1 Mumbai, Delhi, Uttar Pradesh, Baroda win in Vijay Hazare Trophy\n\nAt least four persons died and more than 20 were injured, some critically, when six coaches of the Haridwar-bound Kalinga Utkal Express derailed at Khatauli, 24 km from Muzaffarnagar in western Uttar Pradesh on Saturday evening, officials said.\n\nThe accident took place at 5.46 p.m. when some parts of the tracks were found ripped out. One coach rammed into a house on the sides of the tracks and two coaches climbed one over the other.\n\nThe train was headed from Puri in Odisha to Haridwar in Uttarakhand.\n\nRailway spokesperson Anil Saxena told IANS that four passengers had died.\n\nEarlier, Northern Railways spokesperson Neeraj Sharma told IANS that six coaches of the train had derailed and over 20 passengers were injured.\n\nA team of the ATS of the police has been rushed to the accident site, an official told IANS. The team headed by DSP Anoop Singh will probe any terror angle into the rail accident. NDRF teams have also been rushed to the accident site.\n\nChief Minister Yogi Adityanath spoke to principal secretary (Home) Arvind Kumar and the Muzaffarnagar district magistrate (DM) and directed them to ensure prompt rescue and relief operations at Khatauli.\n\nTwo dozen people, many women and children have been admitted to nearby medical facilities for treatment. The train had left Puri at 9 p.m. on Friday night and was to terminate at Haridwar at 9 p.m. Saturday night.\n\nRailway officials said a medical train was on way and that trains on the route have been diverted through Shamli.\n\nCutters and cranes have been requisitioned to cut the mangled remains of the coaches and rescue people from inside.\n\nAdditional Superintendent of Police, Muzaffarnagar, Ajay Kumar told IANS that police teams were trying to rescue as many passengers trapped in the coaches as possible.\n\nRailways Minister Suresh Prabhu said he was personally monitoring the situation and a probe has been ordered.\n\n\"I am personally monitoring the situation. Have instructed senior officers to reach site immediately and ensure speedy rescue and relief operations,\" Prabhu said in series of tweets.\n\n\"Have ordered an inquiry into the unfortunate accident to ascertain the cause. Strict action will be taken against any lapse,\" he said.\n\nThe Minister said that medical vans have been rushed to the site. All efforts are being taken to ensure speedy relief and rescue operations, he said.\n\nThe Minister said that he was in close touch with Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, state government officials, district administration to coordinate rescue and relief operations.\n\n(This story has not been edited by Business Standard staff and is auto-generated from a syndicated feed.)", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "15:52:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T15:52:00Z"}

"body": "Railway Minister Suresh Prabhu has announced Rs 3.5 lakh ex-gratia for those who have lost their lives in the accident.\n\nIn a major train accident, at least 12 passengers were killed and over 60 injured when 14 coaches of the Puri-Haridwar Utkal Express jumped the rails in Khatauli near here this evening, officials said.\n\nRailways spokesperson Anil Saxena in Delhi said the Uttar Pradesh government has informed the ministry about 12 deaths and 23 people being injured.\n\nChief Medical Officer P S Mishra and ADG (Meerut Zone) Prashant Kumar said at least 11 people were dead and 60 wounded in the accident that took place around 5.45 pm.\n\nKhatauli is around 40 km from Muzaffarnagar. PAC, ATS and NDRF teams have been rushed to the spot. Heavyweight cranes and gas cutters were being used and locals were seen helping out those engaged in rescue work\n\nMuzaffarnagar authorities have set up a control room to assist families of those affected.\n\nThe numbers are: 0131-2436918, 0131-2436103 and 0131- 2436564.\n\nPrime Minister Narendra Modi expressed extreme pain over the derailment and said the Railway Ministry and the state government were doing everything possible and providing all assistance required.\n\nHe said the situation was being monitored very closely by the Railways Ministry.\n\nRailway Minister Suresh Prabhu ordered an inquiry into the derailment. He said he was personally monitoring the situation and strict action will be taken in case of any lapse.\n\nPrabhu also announced Rs 3.5 lakh ex-gratia for those who lost their lives, Rs 50,000 for the seriously injured and Rs 25,000 for those who received minor injuries.\n\nIn a series of tweets, Prabhu said that Minister of State Manoj Sinha has rushed to the spot while the Chairman of Railway Board and Member Traffic have been asked to oversee rescue and relief operations.\n\nTwo National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) teams, comprising 45 personnel each, and two canines have been mobilised to the accident site from their base in Ghaziabad. Medical vans have also been rushed to the site.\n\n\"All efforts being taken to ensure speedy relief and rescue operations,\" Prabhu said.\n\nThe Railway Ministry was also in close touch with the Uttar Pradesh government to coordinate rescue and relief operations.\n\nIn Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh ADG (Law and Order) Anand Kumar said that top priority was being accorded to ensure prompt rescue and relief work.\n\nMeanwhile, Saxena said, \"Initially, we thought that it was only 4-5 coaches, now we have ascertained that 14 coaches have derailed. As of now our focus is on rescue and not on finding reasons for the accident.\"\n\nSince darkness was impeding rescue operations, he said the power department officials had been directed to ensure that there was no shortage of electricity.\n\nKumar also said IMA chapters in Meerut zone have been alerted and asked to ensure adequate and prompt medical care to the injured.\n\nUttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath enquired about the accident and directed officials to take all possible action, an official spokesperson said.Adityanath has directed two of his ministers to reach the site to expedite rescue and relief operations.", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "16:56:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T16:56:00Z"}

false, "textEnd": 59, "date": "2017-08-19", "textStart": 44}], "isDuplicate": false, "dateCrawl": "2017-08-19", "body": "By: Express Web Desk | New Delhi | Updated: August 19, 2017 10:00 pm Kalinga Utkal Express derailment: The mishap took place around 5.45 pm on Saturday. (Source: Twitter/@ani) Muzaffarnagar train accident: At least 11 killed as 14 coaches of Utkal Express derailOne Kanwaria killed, 4 injured in two separate accidents in MuzaffarnagarEight injured in clash over alleged eve-teasing in Muzaffarnagar\n\nAt least 23 people were killed and over 65 injured as 14 coaches of Puri-Haridwar Kalinga Utkal Express derailed in Khatauli area of Muzaffarnagar district on Saturday. The accident took place around 5.45 pm. Union Railway Minister Suresh Prabhu said he is personally monitoring the situation and that he has directed senior officials to take stock of the situation and ensure speedy rescue and relief operations.\n\nThe Union Railway Minister has also announced an ex gratia of Rs 3.5 lakh for the families of those deceased in the accident. Those who have suffered serious injuries will be given Rs 50,000, while those with minor injuries will be given Rs 25 thousand. The cause of the derailment is yet to be ascertained.\n\nMeanwhile, political leaders have expressed their anguish over the derailment.\n\nPresident Ram Nath Kovind\n\nPresident Ram Nath Kovind said his thoughts are with the deceased and their families. \"Sad at train derailment in UP; my thoughts are with deceased and their families. Injured are being rescued & provided relief,\" the President's official Twitter handle tweeted.\n\nPrime Minister Narendra Modi\n\nPrime Minister Narendra Modi said the situation is being very closely monitored by Railways Ministry. \"Extremely pained by the derailment of the Utkal Express in Muzaffarnagar. My thoughts are with the families of the deceased,\" the PMO tweeted on Saturday evening.\n\n\"Railways Ministry and UP Government are doing everything possible & providing all assistance required in the wake of the train derailment,\" he added while wishing a speedy recovery to the injured.\n\nUttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath\n\nUttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath said his sympathies are with the victims and their kin. \"This is an unfortunate incident, we are in constant touch with the Rail Ministry,\" he said while speaking to news agency ANI. \"We don't have exact numbers on casualties but we have sent our two ministers Satish Mahana and Suresh Rana to the spot,\" he added, ensuring the UP government will give all help and support required in the rescue and relief operation.\n\nHe said that directions have been issued to police and other agencies to provide all possible assistance and the injured will be given complete treatment.\n\nCongress Vice-President Rahul Gandhi\n\nCongress Vice-President Rahul Gandhi said he was shocked over the incident. \"Shocked to know about the unfortunate accident of Utkal Express in Muzaffarnagar. My thoughts with the families who lost their loved ones,\" he tweeted.\n\nRJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav\n\nLalu Prasad Yadav asked for the resignation of the Railway Minister. \"How will people travel if there is no guarantee of safety. Railway Minister should resign,\" he said.\n\nPetroleum Minister Dharmendra Pradhan\n\n\"PM is monitoring it, has talked to Railway Minister and UP CM. MLA from Odisha Ravi Naik will visit spot\"\n\nMuzaffarnagar MP Sanjav Balyan\n\n\"I have seen few dead bodies, can't say the exact number, many injured. coaches of the Puri-Haridwar Utkal Express (18477) derailed in Khatauli near here this evening, officials said.\n\nRailways spokesperson Anil Saxena put the number of dead at four and the injured at 20.\n\nThe death toll is expected to be close to 20.\n\nThe mishap took place at the Meerut-Saharanpur section of Delhi division of Northern railway. Sources said some of the coaches crashed into nearby houses causing major damage to public and property.\n\nThe Express train, coming from Puri, was expected to reach Haridwar at 9 pm.\n\nTop police and district administrative officers, including Muzaffarnagar SSP and the district magistrate (DM) were already present on the spot. Even senior officers from National Capital Region (NCR), ambulances and doctors were also rushed to the site of the accident.\n\nRailway Minister Suresh Prabhu ordered an inquiry into the derailment. He said he was personally monitoring the situation and strict action will be taken in case of any lapse.\n\nIn a series of tweets, Prabhu also said that Minister of State Manoj Sinha has rushed to the spot while the Chairman of Railway Board and Member Traffic have been asked to oversee rescue and relief operations.\n\n\"All efforts being taken to ensure speedy relief and rescue operations,\" Prabhu said.\n\nRescue operations are underway and hospitals of Muzaffarnagar and adjoining districts were kept on high alert to attend to the injured with promptness and give them proper medical aid.\n\nThe Railway Ministry was also in close touch with the Uttar Pradesh government to coordinate rescue and relief operations.\n\nThough no official word on the reason for the mishap was out, a team of UP ATS officials left for Muzaffarnagar to look into the cause of the major mishap.\n\nUttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath enquired about the accident and directed officials to take all possible action, an official spokesperson said.\n\nAdityanath has directed two of his ministers to reach the site to expedite rescue and relief operations.\n\nWhile Meerut-based additional deputy general (DG) railway had rushed to the spot, ADG (Law and Order) Anand Kumar said that rescue and relief were the priority and Indian Medical Association (IMA) was also approached by the state government to mobilise hospitals and doctors of the region to attend the injured passengers.\n\nNDRF teams from Delhi were also sent to the spot to join the relief and rescue operation. "storyUri": "eng-3374117", "extractedDates": [{"amb": false, "textEnd": 15, "date": "2017-08-19", "imp": true, "textStart": 9}], "isDuplicate": false, "dateCrawl": "2017-08-19", "body": "Lucknow, Aug 19 (IANS) At least four persons died and more than 20 were injured, some critically, when six coaches of the Haridwar-bound Kalinga Utkal Express derailed at Khatauli, 24 km from Muzaffarnagar in western Uttar Pradesh on Saturday evening, officials said.\n\nThe accident took place at 5.46 p.m. when some parts of the tracks were found ripped out. One coach rammed into a house on the sides of the tracks and two coaches climbed one over the other.\n\nThe train was headed from Puri in Odisha to Haridwar in Uttarakhand.\n\nRailway spokesperson Anil Saxena told IANS that four passengers had died.\n\nEarlier, Northern Railways spokesperson Neeraj Sharma told IANS that six coaches of the train had derailed and over 20 passengers were injured.\n\nA team of the ATS of the police has been rushed to the accident site, an official told IANS. The team headed by DSP Anoop Singh will probe any terror angle into the rail accident. NDRF teams have also been rushed to the accident site.\n\nChief Minister Yogi Adityanath spoke to principal secretary (Home) Arvind Kumar and the Muzaffarnagar district magistrate (DM) and directed them to ensure prompt rescue and relief operations at Khatauli.\n\nTwo dozen people, many women and children have been admitted to nearby medical facilities for treatment. The train had left Puri at 9 p.m. on Friday night and was to terminate at Haridwar at 9 p.m. Saturday night.\n\nRailway officials said a medical train was on way and that trains on the route have been diverted through Shamli.\n\nCutters and cranes have been requisitioned to cut the mangled remains of the coaches and rescue people from inside.\n\nAdditional Superintendent of Police, Muzaffarnagar, Ajay Kumar told IANS that police teams were trying to rescue as many passengers trapped in the coaches as possible.\n\nRailways Minister Suresh Prabhu said he was personally monitoring the situation and a probe has been ordered.\n\n\"I am personally monitoring the situation. Have instructed senior officers to reach site immediately and ensure speedy rescue and relief operations,\" Prabhu said in series of tweets.\n\n\"Have ordered an inquiry into the unfortunate accident to ascertain the cause. Strict action will be taken against any lapse,\" he said.\n\nThe Minister said that medical vans have been rushed to the site. All efforts are being taken to ensure speedy relief and rescue operations, he said.\n\nThe Minister said that he was in close touch with Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, state government officials, district administration to coordinate rescue and relief operations.\n\n--IANS\n\nmd-aks/rn\n\nSEARCH", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "16:08:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T16:08:00Z"}

of six coaches of the Puri-Haridwar-Kalinga Utkal Express which took place near Khatauli railway station in Muzaffarnagar, Uttar Pradesh, Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik on Saturday announced ex gratia of Rs 5 lakhs to the next kin of any Odia passengers killed in the incident.\n\nHe also announced relief of Rs 50,000 for injured.\n\nPatnaik has further directed Commerce and Transport Department to work in coordination with the Indian Railway and the Uttar Pradesh Government to help the injured and victims.\n\nHere are the updates in the incident so far:\n\n- Six coaches of Puri-Haridwar-Kalinga Utkal Express derailed in Muzaffarnagar's Khatauli area\n\n- The incident took place around 5:50 pm.\n\n- Nine Uttar Pradesh Provincial Armed Constabulary (PAC) companies, a team of National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) and Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) have been rushed to the spot.\n\n- Medical vans have been rushed to the site\n\n- Union Railway Minister Suresh Prabhu said that he has ordered inquiry into the unfortunate accident to ascertain the cause.\n\n- Railway Ministry and Uttar Pradesh Government are working hand in hand, informs Prabhu.\n\n- According to the Indian Railways, at least 15 to 20 people have been injured in this incident, while four casualties are reported as of now.\n\n- MoS Railways Manoj Sinha and BJP leader Sanjeev Balyan are at the site.\n\n- Alternate arrangement is being made for stranded passengers. "574878", "score": 3}], "source": {"uri": "dnaindia.com", "id": "492", "title": "Daily News and Analysis (DNA) India"}, "lang": "eng", "date": "2017-08-19", "title": "23 dead as 14 coaches of Utkal Exp derails in UP", "storyUri": "eng-3374117", "extractedDates": null, "isDuplicate": false, "dateCrawl": "2017-08-19", "body": "Fourteen coaches of a high- speed Utkal Express today jumped the rails, with one of them crashing into a house adjacent to the track near Khatauli this evening, claiming at least 23 lives and leaving a large number of passengers injured.\n\nThe accident occured around 5.45 pm near Khatauli town in this district and left 23 people dead and over 60 injured, the Uttar Pradesh Police said. Khatauli is around 40 km from Muzaffarnagar.\n\nRailway ministry officials in Delhi, however, put the number of dead at 12. The train was coming from Puri in Odisha and going to Haridwar in Uttarakhand, normally a journey of about 36 hours.\n\nPosses of PAC, ATS and NDRF teams, as also sniffer dog squads, were rushed to the spot to carry out rescue operations. The injured\n\nHeavyweight cranes and gas cutters were being used to lift or cut the mangled remains of the coaches and extricate passengers stuck inside.\n\nLarge number of local people and villagers were also seen helping out those engaged in the rescue work.\n\nPolicemen on the site said one of the derailed coaches had crashed into the wall of a house adjacent to the railway track and some people are feared to be trapped in the debris.\n\nAnand Kumar, ADG (Law and Order), said the team of Anti- Terrorist Squad (ATS) will assist in the rescue measures and also look at any aspect of \"sabotage\".\n\nWhen asked by a reporter whether there was any terror angle in the accident, state DGP Sulkhan Singh said so far there was no such information, but \"UP ATS will investigate into the causes of the accident.\"\n\nThe coaches damaged were S1 to S10 sleeper class, third AC B1, second AC A1 coach and the pantry.\n\nMuzaffarnagar authorities have set up a control room to assist families of those affected. The numbers are: 0131- 2436918, 0131-2436103 and 0131-2436564.\n\nPrime Minister Narendra Modi expressed extreme pain over the derailment and said the Railway Ministry and the state government were doing everything possible and providing all assistance required.\n\nHe said the situation was being monitored very closely by the Railways Ministry.\n\nAt least 10 passenger trains on the busy route were diverted following the accident, a Northern Railway release said.\n\nRailway Minister Suresh Prabhu ordered an inquiry into the derailment. He said he was personally monitoring the situation and strict action will be taken in case of any lapse.\n\nPrabhu also announced Rs 3.5 lakh ex-gratia for those who lost their lives, Rs 50,000 for the seriously injured and Rs 25,000 for those who received minor injuries.\n\nPrincipal Secretary (Information) Avanish Awasthi said Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has announced a compensation of Rs 2 lakh for the kin of the dead and Rs 50,000 for those injured.\n\nIn a series of tweets, Prabhu said that Minister of State Manoj Sinha has rushed to the spot while the Chairman of Railway Board and Member Traffic have been asked to oversee rescue and relief operations.\n\nTwo National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) teams, comprising 45 personnel each, and two canines have been mobilised to the accident site from their base in Ghaziabad.\n\nMedical vans have also been rushed to the site.\n\n\"All efforts being taken to ensure speedy relief and rescue operations,\" Prabhu said.\n\nThe Railway Ministry was also in close touch with the Uttar Pradesh government to coordinate rescue and relief operations.\n\nIn Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh ADG (Law and Order) Anand Kumar said that top priority was being accorded to ensure prompt rescue and relief work.\n\nMeanwhile, Railways spokesperson Anil Saxena said, \"Initially, we thought that it was only 4-5 coaches, now we have ascertained that 14 coaches have derailed. As of now our focus is on rescue and not on finding reasons for the accident.\"\n\nSince darkness was impeding rescue operations, he said the power department officials had been directed to ensure that there was no shortage of electricity.\n\nKumar also said IMA chapters in Meerut zone have been alerted and asked to ensure adequate and prompt medical care to the injured.\n\nUttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath enquired about the accident and directed officials to take all possible action, an official spokesperson said.\n\nAdityanath has directed two of his ministers -- Suresh Rana and Satish Mahana -- to reach the site to expedite rescue and relief operations.\n\n(This article has not been edited by DNA's editorial team and is auto-generated from an agency feed.)", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "17:46:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T17:46:00Z"}

"http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Railway_Board_(India)", "id": "472191", "score": 2}], "source": {"uri": "deccanherald.com", "id": "1679", "title": "Deccan Herald"}, "lang": "eng", "date": "2017-08-19", "title": "12 dead, 60 wounded as 14 coaches of Utkal Exp derails in UP", "storyUri": "eng-3374117", "extractedDates": null, "isDuplicate": false, "dateCrawl": "2017-08-19", "body": "Several people have been injured, rescue operation is underway. Picture courtesy Twitter\n\nIn a major train accident, at least 12 passengers were killed and over 60 injured when 14 coaches of the Puri-Haridwar Utkal Express jumped the rails in Khatauli near here this evening, officials said.\n\nRailways spokesperson Anil Saxena in Delhi said the Uttar Pradesh government has informed the ministry about 12 deaths and 23 people being injured.\n\nChief Medical Officer P S Mishra and ADG (Meerut Zone) Prashant Kumar said at least 11 people were dead and 60 wounded in the accident that took place around 5.45 pm.\n\nKhatauli is around 40 km from Muzaffarnagar. PAC, ATS and NDRF teams have been rushed to the spot. Heavyweight cranes and gas cutters were being used and locals were seen helping out those engaged in rescue work\n\nMuzaffarnagar authorities have set up a control room to assist families of those affected. The numbers are: 0131-2436918, 0131-2436103 and 0131- 2436564.\n\nPrime Minister Narendra Modi expressed extreme pain over the derailment and said the Railway Ministry and the state government were doing everything possible and providing all assistance required. He said the situation was being monitored very closely by the Railways Ministry.\n\nRailway Minister Suresh Prabhu ordered an inquiry into the derailment. He said he was personally monitoring the situation and strict action will be taken in case of any lapse.\n\nPrabhu also announced Rs 3.5 lakh ex-gratia for those who lost their lives, Rs 50,000 for the seriously injured and Rs 25,000 for those who received minor injuries.\n\nIn a series of tweets, Prabhu said that Minister of State Manoj Sinha has rushed to the spot while the Chairman of Railway Board and Member Traffic have been asked to oversee rescue and relief operations.\n\nTwo National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) teams, comprising 45 personnel each, and two canines have been mobilised to the accident site from their base in Ghaziabad. Medical vans have also been rushed to the site. \"All efforts being taken to ensure speedy relief and rescue operations,\" Prabhu said.\n\nThe Railway Ministry was also in close touch with the Uttar Pradesh government to coordinate rescue and relief operations.\n\nIn Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh ADG (Law and Order) Anand Kumar said that top priority was being accorded to ensure prompt rescue and relief work.\n\nMeanwhile, Saxena said, \"Initially, we thought that it was only 4-5 coaches, now we have ascertained that 14 coaches have derailed. As of now our focus is on rescue and not on finding reasons for the accident.\"\n\nSince darkness was impeding rescue operations, he said the power department officials had been directed to ensure that there was no shortage of electricity.\n\nKumar also said IMA chapters in Meerut zone have been alerted and asked to ensure adequate and prompt medical care to the injured.\n\nUttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath enquired about the accident and directed officials to take all possible action, an official spokesperson said.\n\nAdityanath has directed two of his ministers to reach the site to expedite rescue and relief operations.", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "16:33:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T16:33:00Z"}

Picture courtesy Twitter\n\nAt least 50 people, including women and children, were injured, when Haridwar bound Utkal Express train derailed in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar district, about 500 kilometres from here, on Saturday.\n\nThough eyewitness accounts claimed that some passengers had also been killed in the mishap, police officials here did not confirm the same.\n\nPolice sources here said that the mishap occurred near Khatauli railway station, which 22 kilometres from the district headquarters.\n\nSources said that six coaches of the train, which was on its way to Haridwar in Uttarakhand from Puri in Odisha, derailed near a village. One of the coaches also rammed into the houses, which were close to the railway tracks.\n\nOfficials said that medical teams had been rushed to the spot from Meerut, Saharanpur and other nearby districts. Ambulances have also been rushed to the spot, sources said.\n\nThe injured were admitted to the nearby hospitals in Meerut and Muzaffarnagar, the officials said adding that hospitals in the NCR region had been put on alert following the mishap. Some of the injured were stated to be in a critical condition.\n\nSources quoting eye witnesses said that some of the derailed coaches had climbed on other coaches.", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "13:39:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T13:39:00Z"}

"574878", "score": 1}], "source": {"uri": "newindianexpress.com", "id": "934", "title": "The New Indian Express"}, "lang": "eng", "date": "2017-08-19", "title": "23 dead as 14 coaches of Utkal Express derails in UP's Muzaffarnagar", "storyUri": "eng-3374117", "extractedDates": null, "isDuplicate": false, "dateCrawl": "2017-08-19", "body": "LUCKNOW: Fourteen coaches of a high- speed Utkal Express today jumped the rails, with one of them\n\ncrashing into a house adjacent to the track near Khatauli this evening, claiming at least 23 lives and leaving a large number of passengers injured.\n\nThe accident occurred around 5.45 pm near Khatauli town in this district and left 23 people dead and over 60 injured, the Uttar Pradesh Police said. Khatauli is around 40 km from Muzaffarnagar.\n\nWATCH VIDEO | At least 23 dead after passenger train derails in northern India\n\nThe Express train, coming from Puri, was expected to reach Haridwar at 9 pm.\n\nChief Medical Officer P S Mishra and ADG (Meerut Zone) Prashant Kumar said at least 11 people were dead and 60 wounded in the accident that took place around 5.45 pm.\n\nThe coaches damaged were S1 to S10 sleeper class, third AC B1, second AC A1 coach and the pantry.\n\nKhatauli is around 40 km from Muzaffarnagar. PAC, ATS and NDRF teams have been rushed to the spot. Heavyweight cranes and gas cutters were being used and locals were seen helping out those engaged in rescue work\n\nTop police and district administrative officers, including Muzaffarnagar SSP and the district magistrate (DM) were already present on the spot. Even senior officers from National Capital Region (NCR), ambulances and doctors were also rushed to the site of the accident.\n\nAt least 10 passenger trains on the busy route were diverted following the accident, a Northern Railway release said.\n\nRescue operations are underway and hospitals of Muzaffarnagar and adjoining districts were kept on high alert to attend to the injured with promptness and give them proper medical aid.\n\nThough no official word on the reason for the mishap was out, a team of UP ATS officials left for Muzaffarnagar to look into the cause of the major mishap.\n\nRailway Minister Suresh Prabhu ordered an inquiry into the derailment. He said he was personally monitoring the situation and strict action will be taken in case of any lapse.\n\nIn a series of tweets, Prabhu also said that Minister of State Manoj Sinha has rushed to the spot while the Chairman of Railway Board and Member Traffic have been asked to oversee rescue and relief operations.\n\n\"All efforts being taken to ensure speedy relief and rescue operations,\" Prabhu said.\n\nHe also announced Rs 3.5 lakh ex-gratia for those who lost their lives, Rs 50,000 for the seriously injured and Rs 25,000 for those who received minor injuries\n\nPrime Minister Narendra Modi expressed extreme pain over the derailment and said the Railway Ministry and the state government were doing everything possible and providing all assistance required.\n\nHe said the situation was being monitored very closely by the Railways Ministry.\n\nRescue operations are underway and hospitals of Muzaffarnagar and adjoining districts were kept on high alert to attend to the injured with promptness and give them proper medical aid.\n\nThe Railway Ministry was also in close touch with the Uttar Pradesh government to coordinate rescue and relief operations.\n\nWhile Meerut-based additional deputy general (DG) railway had rushed to the spot, ADG (Law and Order) Anand Kumar said that rescue and relief were the priority and Indian Medical Association (IMA) was also approached by the state government to mobilise hospitals and doctors of the region to attend the injured passengers.\n\nNDRF teams from Delhi were also sent to the spot to join the relief and rescue operation.\n\nUttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath enquired about the accident and directed officials to take all possible action, an official spokesperson said.\n\nPrincipal Secretary (Information) Avanish Awasthi said that Adityanath has announced a compensation of Rs 2 lakh for the kin of the dead and Rs 50,000 for those injured.\n\nAdityanath has directed two of his ministers to reach the site to expedite rescue and relief operations.\n\nHaridwar railway administration has released two helpline numbers: 9760534054,5101\n\nMuzaffarnagar authorities too have set up a control room to assist families of those affected.", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "17:25:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T17:25:00Z"}
