"storyUri": "eng-3374117", "extractedDates": null, "isDuplicate": false, "dateCrawl": "2017-08-19", "body": "At least 23 persons were killed and around 400 injured when 14 coaches of the Puri-Haridwar Utkal Express derailed on Saturday evening at Khatauli, near Muzaffarnagar, Uttar Pradesh police officials said.\n\nIt was 5.46 p.m. on Saturday when the Haridwar- bound train derailed immediately after it crossed the Khatauli station.\n\nNational Disaster Response Force (NDRF) personnel told The Hindu that the number of dead could rise as several passengers were still trapped in the wreckage. Officials said 100 persons were seriously injured. Rescue operations have slowed down after darkness.\n\nThe Railway Ministry is yet to comment on the reason for the accident but the impact of the accident was strong enough to send a derailed coach crashing into a house in Jagat colony, a railway colony next to the tracks.\n\nOut of total 14 coaches, three were third AC coaches and the rest were sleeper coaches.Senior Railway Ministry officials present on the spot told The Hindu that \"though the investigation is yet to be concluded but preliminary probe suggests that the driver of the Kalinga Express had applied sudden breaks as he found repair works going on the track which led to the accident.\n\nAccording to eye witnesses many pedestrians walking on the road near the railway track were also injured in the accident.\n\nSeveral eyewitnesses said there was loud sound preceding the derailment. \"There was an extremely loud sound which attracted people's attention before the train was derailed. We saw some coaches dangling in the air and falling off, some of them on each other,\" Jaiveer, an eyewitness said.\n\nMost of the injured were in a state of shock. Many elderly people were lying near the tracks, struggling to overcome the trauma. too shocked that they were unable to remember anything. But there were many bodies of men and women, some of them bloody, on one side of the derailed train. Eyewitnesses who were rescuing people were recounting how it happened.\n\nA passenger Vishal travelling in one of the AC coaches said, \"There was huge loud noise. Before I could realise, it was all dark and there was huge movement and shaking as if it was an earthquake had hit. I think that was the last thing I remember.\" He sustained a minor injury on his head and was rescued by local people.\n\nThere was minor skirmish between the local residents and the police when the crowd which was busy in rescuing people accused the administration of reaching late but soon the rescue mission started in full speed with all the senior police officers of Meerut and Muzaffarnagar range, BJP MP from Muzaffarnagar Sanjeev Baliyan, Suresh Rana, a member of Yogi Adityanath government, on the spot supervising the rescue mission with equipmen to cut open the mangled coaches.\n\nHundreds of passengers came out from other coaches and started looking for their friends and fellow passengers. There were many like Kabir Rathor whose parents were travelling in the train. \"I must thank god that my parents are safe. They were coming from Gwalior for the purpose of bathing on the occassion of Somvati Amavasya,\" Rathor said with relief and tension both palpable on his face.\n\n\"The cause of the derailment is difficult to escertain at this moment. All possibilities are being explored. Even the Anti-Terrorist Squad is at the accident site,\" said a senior Railway Ministry official.\n\nMinister of State Railways Manoj Sinha, Railway Board Member Traffic Mohd. Jamshed and Railway Board Member Engineering A.K. Mittal have rushed to the accident spot, Railway Minister Suresh Prabhu said.\n\n\"I have ordered inquiry into the unfortunate accident to ascertain the cause. Strict action will be taken against any lapse,\" Mr. Prabhu said, adding he has requested Minister of State for Water Resources, River Development and Ganga Rejuvenation Dr. Sanjeev Balyan to reach the accident site as well.\n\nAn accident alert has been issued to all the hospitals in Meerut and the National Capital Region Uttar Pradesh anti-terrorist squad has reached the site too on the instructions of state ADG (law and order) Anand Kumar.\n\nA.K. Gupta in charge of CHC Khatauli told the media that over all 150 people were admitted by 10 p.m. in the night and 30 serious patients were referred to the Meerut hospital.\n\nU.P. Health Minister Siddhharth Nath Singh tweeted that the State government mobilised medical services and instructed chief medical officers of Meerut and Muzaffarnagar to extend all help to the injured.\n\nChief medical officer, Meerut, Dr Rajkumar told The Hindu that 26 government ambulances have been sent to the accident site. Additionally, 20 ambulances from private hospitals have also been rushed to the spot.\n\nDr Rajkumar added that all hospitals, including the medical college in Meerut, have been put on high alert. \"The district hospital in Meerut is admitting serious patients. We are all prepared,\"he added.\n\nMeanwhile Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath and Railway Minister Suresh Prabhu announced an ex-gratia of \u20b93.5 lakh for kin of dead, \u20b9 50,000 for the seriously injured and \u20b925,000 for those with minor injuries. Mr Adtiyanath has announced \u20b92 lakh for the families of the deceased and \u20b9 50,000 for those injured.\n\nExpressing deep anguish over the loss of lives in derailment of Kalinga Utkal Express in Uttar Pradesh, Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik said, \"my thoughts and prayers are with victims' families and the injured.\"\n\nMr. Patnaik spoke to Union Railway Minister Suresh Prabhu who had assured all help to the affected passengers.\n\nThe Odisha government has announced an ex-gratia of \u20b95 lakh for next of kin of passengers from the State killed in the derailment. The State government will also pay \u20b950,000 for the injured and for treatment in any hospital.\n\nPrime Minister Narendra Modi expressed extreme pain over the accident and assured that the Railway Ministry and State government were doing everything possible to provide the required assistance.\n\nFrom January-June this year, total 29 serious train accidents took place out of which 20 accidents happened due to train derailment that killed at least 39 people and injured 54. In 2016-17, 78 derailments took place on railway tracks two of which were attributed to 'coach defect.'\n\nIn the last five years, between 2012-13 and 2016-17, out of total 586 accidents, 308 occurred due to derailments and 199 because of unmanned level crossings. Out of total 1,011 casualties, 347 were killed due to train derailments and 449 because of unmanned level crossings.\n\nThis is the second serious train derailment case in Uttar Pradesh in the last few months. In November last year, 14 coaches of the Patna-bound Indore-Rajendranagar Express train derailed between Pokhrayan and Malasa stations in Uttar Pradesh, killing 152 passengers and injuring 183.", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "18:44:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T18:44:00Z"}

of Utkal Exp derails in UP", "storyUri": "eng-3374117", "extractedDates": null, "isDuplicate": false, "dateCrawl": "2017-08-19", "body": "In a major train accident, at least 12 passengers were killed and over 60 injured when 14 coaches of the Puri-Haridwar Utkal Express jumped the rails in Khatauli near here this evening, officials said.\n\nRailways spokesperson Anil Saxena in Delhi said the Uttar Pradesh government has informed the ministry about 12 deaths and 23 people being injured.\n\nChief Medical Officer P S Mishra and ADG (Meerut Zone) Prashant Kumar said at least 11 people were dead and 60 wounded in the accident that took place around 5.45 pm.\n\nKhatauli is around 40 km from Muzaffarnagar. PAC, ATS and NDRF teams have been rushed to the spot. Heavyweight cranes and gas cutters were being used and locals were seen helping out those engaged in rescue work\n\nMuzaffarnagar authorities have set up a control room to assist families of those affected.\n\nThe numbers are: 0131-2436918, 0131-2436103 and 0131- 2436564.\n\nPrime Minister Narendra Modi expressed extreme pain over the derailment and said the Railway Ministry and the state government were doing everything possible and providing all assistance required.\n\nHe said the situation was being monitored very closely by the Railways Ministry.\n\nRailway Minister Suresh Prabhu ordered an inquiry into the derailment. He said he was personally monitoring the situation and strict action will be taken in case of any lapse.\n\nPrabhu also announced Rs 3.5 lakh ex-gratia for those who lost their lives, Rs 50,000 for the seriously injured and Rs 25,000 for those who received minor injuries.\n\nIn a series of tweets, Prabhu said that Minister of State Manoj Sinha has rushed to the spot while the Chairman of Railway Board and Member Traffic have been asked to oversee rescue and relief operations.\n\nTwo National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) teams, comprising 45 personnel each, and two canines have been mobilised to the accident site from their base in Ghaziabad.\n\nMedical vans have also been rushed to the site.\n\n\"All efforts being taken to ensure speedy relief and rescue operations,\" Prabhu said.\n\nThe Railway Ministry was also in close touch with the Uttar Pradesh government to coordinate rescue and relief operations.\n\nIn Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh ADG (Law and Order) Anand Kumar said that top priority was being accorded to ensure prompt rescue and relief work.\n\nMeanwhile, Saxena said, \"Initially, we thought that it was only 4-5 coaches, now we have ascertained that 14 coaches have derailed. As of now our focus is on rescue and not on finding reasons for the accident.\"\n\nSince darkness was impeding rescue operations, he said the power department officials had been directed to ensure that there was no shortage of electricity.\n\nKumar also said IMA chapters in Meerut zone have been alerted and asked to ensure adequate and prompt medical care to the injured.\n\nUttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath enquired about the accident and directed officials to take all possible action, an official spokesperson said.\n\nAdityanath has directed two of his ministers to reach the site to expedite rescue and relief operations.\n\n(This article has not been edited by DNA's editorial team and is auto-generated from an agency feed.)", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "16:29:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T16:29:00Z"}

PTI\n\nFourteen coaches of the Utkal Express, which had left Puri on the night of 17 August for Haridwar, derailed at Khatauli in Muzaffarnagar district of Uttar Pradesh this evening, causing deaths and injuries.\n\nAltogether 86 passengers, 80 in sleeper class and six in AC coach had boarded the train at Puri station.\n\nRailway officials in New Delhi said the Uttar Pradesh government has informed the ministry of 12 deaths in the derailment.\n\nPatnaik, who is presently in Delhi, spoke to Railway Minister Suresh Prabhu and sought his assistance for the rescue of the passengers and the union minister assured him of all assistance to the affected passengers, the statement said.\n\nPatnaik also directed the chief secretary to remain in touch with the railway authorities. He also asked the state's commerce and transport department to work in coordination with the railways and Uttar Pradesh government to provide help to the injured persons and kin of the deceased passengers.\n\nMeanwhile, relatives of the affected passengers gathered at Bhubaneswar and Cuttack railway stations to inquire about the fate of their kin.\n\nThe East Coast Railway has opened a helpline number, 1072, to provide information on the accident.\n\nPublished Date: Aug 19, 2017 10:43 pm | Updated Date: Aug 19, 2017 10:43 pm\n\nTags :#Ex gratia#Haridwar#Khatauli#Muzaffarnagar#Naveen patnaik#Newstracker#Suresh prabhu#Utkal express#Uttar pradesh", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "17:31:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T17:31:00Z"}

"http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ministry_of_Railways_(India)", "id": "454052", "score": 2}, {"type": "wiki", "label": {"eng": "Ram Nath Kovind"}, "uri": "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ram_Nath_Kovind", "id": "1340741", "score": 2}], "source": {"uri": "news.xinhuanet.com", "id": "942", "title": "Xinhuanet.com"}, "lang": "eng", "date": "2017-08-19", "title": "23 killed, 40 injured in India train accident", "storyUri": "eng-3374117", "extractedDates": [{"amb": false, "textEnd": 18, "date": "2017-08-19", "imp": true, "textStart": 11}], "isDuplicate": false, "dateCrawl": "2017-08-19", "body": "NEW DELHI, Aug. 19 (Xinhua) -- At least 23 people were killed and over 40 others injured, some of them critically, on Saturday after a passenger train derailed in northern Indian state of Uttar Pradesh, police said.\n\nAccording to Indian railways spokesperson, 14 coaches of the train derailed in the accident.\n\nThe accident took place in Muzaffarnagar district of Uttar Pradesh, around 100 km from New Delhi, India's national capital.\n\nA derailed coach hit a nearby house, damaging it severely, reports said.\n\n\"Today a train derailed here causing coaches to fall upon one another,\" a statement issued by Uttar Pradesh police to local media said. \"In this tragedy, 23 people were killed and over 40 others injured, who were admitted in different hospitals.\"\n\nThere are fears some passengers might be caught inside mangled coaches and death toll is likely to increase.\n\nOfficials said the injured were being admitted at Khatauli, Meerut and Muzaffarnagar hospitals.\n\nAuthorities have rushed police and disaster response force personnel to the spot to carry out rescue work. The rescuers were seen using gas cutters to cut the steel and help the people trapped inside the coaches.\n\nA crane has also been brought to the spot to lift the derailed coaches.\n\nTelevision images showed huge crowd gathered at the accident site.\n\nThe train Utkal Express derailed in Muzaffarnagar's Khatauli area at around 5:45 p.m. local time. Railway ministry officials said the cause of accident was not immediately known.\n\nThe Indian railway ministry has ordered an inquiry into the accident.\n\n\"Have ordered inquiry into the unfortunate accident to ascertain the cause. Strict action will be taken against any lapse,\" Indian railway minister Suresh Prabu said. \"I am personally monitoring situation.\"\n\nFollowing the derailment, locals first rushed to the spot to help people trapped in the derailed coaches and subsequently informed the police and railway officials.\n\n\"Most of the rescue work was carried out by locals. Official assistance reached late,\" Atul Srivastava, a local volunteer, said.\n\nThe Indian government has announced a compensation of 7,792 U.S. dollars for each family that has lost a member in the accident, while the injured will be given an assistance of 1,558 dollars each.\n\nMeanwhile, Indian President Ram Nath Kovind and Prime Minister Narendra Modi have expressed grief over the accident.\n\n\"Extremely pained by the derailment of the Utkal Express in Muzaffarnagar. My thoughts are with the families of the deceased,\" Modi said and wished a speedy recovery for injured in the accident.\n\n\"Railways Ministry and Uttar Pradesh Government are doing everything possible and providing all assistance required in wake of the train derailment,\" Modi said.\n\nIn January this year, 39 people were killed and over 50 injured in train derailment in southern Indian state of Andhra Pradesh.\n\nThe Indian government in 2015 announced an investment of over 137 billion dollars over a period of five years to boost railways and modernise it on new lines.\n\nIndian sprawling railways are the world's third largest network, ferrying around 23 million people each day.\n\nLast year a train accident in Uttar Pradesh killed 145 and injured around 200.", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "17:37:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T17:37:00Z"}

"extractedDates": null, "isDuplicate": false, "dateCrawl": "2017-08-19", "body": "LUCKNOW: As many as 20 persons were feared dead and scores were injured in a major train accident as 10 coaches of Puri-Haridwar Utkal Express (18477) derailed near Khatauli railway station under Kotwali police station of Muzaffarnagar district on Saturday evening.\n\nThe mishap took place at the Meerut-Saharanpur section of Delhi division of Northern railway. Sources said some of the coaches crashed into nearby houses causing major damage to public and property.\n\nThe Express train, coming from Puri, was expected to reach Haridwar at 9 pm.\n\nTop police and district administrative officers, including Muzaffarnagar SSP and the district magistrate (DM) were already present on the spot. Even senior officers from National Capital Region (NCR), ambulances and doctors were also rushed to the site of the accident.\n\nRescue operations are underway and hospitals of Muzaffarnagar and adjoining districts were kept on high alert to attend to the injured with promptness and give them proper medical aid.\n\nThough no official word on the reason for the mishap was out, a team of UP ATS officials left for Muzaffarnagar to look into the cause of the major mishap.\n\nWhile Meerut-based additional deputy general (DG) railway had rushed to the spot, ADG (Law and Order) Anand Kumar said that rescue and relief were the priority and Indian Medical Association (IMA) was also approached by the state government to mobilise hospitals and doctors of the region to attend the injured passengers.\n\nNDRF teams from Delhi were also sent to the spot to join the relief and rescue operation. launched a scathing attack on Prime Minister Narendra Modi over the recent derailment of the Puri-Haridwar-Kalinga Utkal Express.\n\nThe Congress Party on Saturday launched a scathing attack on Prime Minister Narendra Modi over the recent derailment of the Puri-Haridwar-Kalinga Utkal Express, near Khatauli railway station in Muzaffarnagar and accused the Centre of being careless regarding the safety of the passengers travelling with the Indian Railways which has claimed so many lives in past three years. \"Since Modi Govt took over in May 2014, 259 passengers have lost their lives & 899 injured in 27 train accidents. When will Govt wake up?,\" Congress leader Randeep Surjewala told ANI. Surjewala further said that the railway safety still remains under the cloud of question mark with such accidents taking place at continuous basis. \"If Prime Minister Modi can spend Rs 1 lakh crore on a bullet train, which he promised between Ahmadabad and Mumbai, why can't he allocate 40 thousand crore for railway safety. We have seen platform tickets go up. We have seen, passengers fare go up, but railway safety remains under a serious cloud,\" he told ANI.\n\nFurther stressing on the same, Surjewala requested the government to wake up from their sleep and take some action after taking lessons from this incident. \"We sincerely hope and request the government to at least wake up from its slumber taking a lesson from this painful train accident in Muzaffarnagar and ensure that adequate time bound measures are taken for the railway safety,\" he said. Surjewala said that no amount of compensation and money can bring back the lives of those who have died. \"Important question is how they are going to prevent such incidents from happening in future. What steps have they taken and lesson learnt from such incident,\" he added.\n\nHere are the updates so far:\n\n- Fourteen coaches of Puri-Haridwar-Kalinga Utkal Express derailed in Muzaffarnagar's Khatauli area\n\n- 23 people have lost their lives till now and 40 are said to be injured.\n\n- The incident took place around 5:50 pm.\n\n- Indian Railways released emergency helpline number for detail information.\n\n#Muzaffarnagar train derailment: Indian Railways release emergency helpline number for detail information. pic.twitter.com/r1nV1Y0r6l\n\n-- ANI UP (@ANINewsUP) August 19, 2017\n\n- Nine Uttar Pradesh Provincial Armed Constabulary (PAC) companies, a team of National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) and Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) have been rushed to the spot.\n\n- Medical vans have also been rushed to the site\n\n- Union Railway Minister Suresh Prabhu said that he has ordered inquiry into the unfortunate accident to ascertain the cause.\n\n- Railway Ministry and Uttar Pradesh Government are working hand in hand, informs Prabhu.\n\n- As per sources repair work was underway at the track.\n\n- MoS Railways Manoj Sinha and BJP leader Sanjeev Balyan are at the site.\n\n- An alternate arrangement is being made for stranded passengers.\n\n-Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik announced ex gratia of Rs 5 lakhs to the next kin of any Odia passengers killed in the incident. He also announced relief of Rs 50,000 for injured.\n\n- Union Minister of Railway Suresh Prabhu announced ex gratia of Rs 3.5 lakh for the next kin, Rs. 50,000 for those seriously injured and Rs. 25, 000 for people with minor injuries.\n\n- Former chief minister of Uttar Pradesh Mulayam Singh Yadav and Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Raman Singh expressed condolences to the grieving kin of the victim.\n\n- President Ram Nath Kovind and Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed condolences to the grieving kin of the victims who lost their lives in the derailment of the Puri-Haridwar-Kalinga Utkal Express.\n\n- Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath said that he has sent two of his ministers to the accident spot to take a stock of the situation.", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "18:38:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T18:38:00Z"}

"id": "2369", "title": "english.sina.com"}, "lang": "eng", "date": "2017-08-19", "title": "23 killed, 40 injured in India train accident", "storyUri": "eng-3374117", "extractedDates": [{"amb": false, "textEnd": 18, "date": "2017-08-19", "imp": true, "textStart": 11}], "isDuplicate": false, "dateCrawl": "2017-08-19", "body": "NEW DELHI, Aug. 19 (Xinhua) -- At least 23 people were killed and over 40 others injured, some of them critically, on Saturday after a passenger train derailed in northern Indian state of Uttar Pradesh, police said.\n\nAccording to Indian railways spokesperson, 14 coaches of the train derailed in the accident.\n\nThe accident took place in Muzaffarnagar district of Uttar Pradesh, around 100 km from New Delhi, India's national capital.\n\nA derailed coach hit a nearby house, damaging it severely, reports said.\n\n\"Today a train derailed here causing coaches to fall upon one another,\" a statement issued by Uttar Pradesh police to local media said. \"In this tragedy, 23 people were killed and over 40 others injured, who were admitted in different hospitals.\"\n\nThere are fears some passengers might be caught inside mangled coaches and death toll is likely to increase.\n\nOfficials said the injured were being admitted at Khatauli, Meerut and Muzaffarnagar hospitals.\n\nAuthorities have rushed police and disaster response force personnel to the spot to carry out rescue work. The rescuers were seen using gas cutters to cut the steel and help the people trapped inside the coaches.\n\nA crane has also been brought to the spot to lift the derailed coaches.\n\nTelevision images showed huge crowd gathered at the accident site.\n\nThe train Utkal Express derailed in Muzaffarnagar's Khatauli area at around 5:45 p.m. local time. Railway ministry officials said the cause of accident was not immediately known.\n\nThe Indian railway ministry has ordered an inquiry into the accident.\n\n\"Have ordered inquiry into the unfortunate accident to ascertain the cause. Strict action will be taken against any lapse,\" Indian railway minister Suresh Prabu said. \"I am personally monitoring situation.\"\n\nFollowing the derailment, locals first rushed to the spot to help people trapped in the derailed coaches and subsequently informed the police and railway officials.\n\n\"Most of the rescue work was carried out by locals. Official assistance reached late,\" Atul Srivastava, a local volunteer, said.\n\nThe Indian government has announced a compensation of 7,792 U.S. dollars for each family that has lost a member in the accident, while the injured will be given an assistance of 1,558 dollars each.\n\nMeanwhile, Indian President Ram Nath Kovind and Prime Minister Narendra Modi have expressed grief over the accident.\n\n\"Extremely pained by the derailment of the Utkal Express in Muzaffarnagar. My thoughts are with the families of the deceased,\" Modi said and wished a speedy recovery for injured in the accident.\n\n\"Railways Ministry and Uttar Pradesh Government are doing everything possible and providing all assistance required in wake of the train derailment,\" Modi said.\n\nIn January this year, 39 people were killed and over 50 injured in train derailment in southern Indian state of Andhra Pradesh.\n\nThe Indian government in 2015 announced an investment of over 137 billion dollars over a period of five years to boost railways and modernise it on new lines.\n\nIndian sprawling railways are the world's third largest network, ferrying around 23 million people each day.\n\nLast year a train accident in Uttar Pradesh killed 145 and injured around 200.\n\nChinese scientists conduct research in western Pacific Ocean\n\nChina issues commemorative stamps for BRICS Summit\n\nPeople mourn victims of Barcelona terror attack\n\nGiant panda twins celebrate 2nd birthday\n\nAt least 2 died, 8 injured in knife attack in Turku, Finland\n\n13 killed, over 100 others injured in Barcelona attack: official\n\nOver 400 killed in mudslides in Sierra Leone\n\nQiandaohu Lake in China's Zhejiang under stricter protection", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "18:28:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T18:28:00Z"}

people were injured after six coaches of the Utkal Express derailed near Khatauli in Uttar Pradesh, officials said.\n\nAccording to railway officials, the incident occurred around 5.46 p.m. in Khatauli, in Muzaffarnagar district.\n\nThe train was headed from Puri in Odisha to Haridwar in Uttarakhand.\n\nNorthern Railways spokesperson Neeraj Sharma told IANS, \"Six coaches of the train derailed in which over 20 passengers have been injured.\"\n\nHe said the railways has rushed medical vans to the site and rescue operations are underway.\n\nRailways Minister Suresh Prabhu said he was personally monitoring the situation and a probe has been ordered.\n\n\"I am personally monitoring situation. Have instructed senior officers to reach site immediately and ensure speedy rescue and relief operations,\" Prabhu said in series of tweets.\n\n\"Have ordered an inquiry into the unfortunate accident to ascertain the cause. Strict action will be taken against any lapse,\" he said.\n\nThe Minister said that medical vans have been rushed to the site. [{"amb": false, "textEnd": 18, "date": "2017-08-19", "imp": true, "textStart": 9}], "isDuplicate": false, "dateCrawl": "2017-08-19", "body": "[India], August 19 (ANI): The Indian Railways has informed that 14 coaches of the Puri-Haridwar-Kalinga Utkal Express derailed near Khatauli railway station in Muzaffarnagar, adding that at least 11 people have died and over 30 have been injured.\n\nSpeaking to ANI here, Director-general and Public Relation Officer of the Indian Railway Anil Saxena said, \"14 coaches got derailed. As the result of the accident, there are some casualties and injuries. Till now we have the confirmation of ten deaths in this unfortunate tragedy. 13 people have been taken for their injuries to various hospitals. Some are of them are admitted due to shock also.\"\n\nHe further apprised that from Delhi, Minister of state for railways, Manoj Sinha, Member Traffic, Railway Board Mohammad Jamshed have rushed for the accident site.\n\n\"This is addition to the staff from the Delhi division who already had left earlier for the accident site,\" he said.\n\nHere are the updates so far:\n\n- Fourteen coaches of Puri-Haridwar-Kalinga Utkal Express derailed in Muzaffarnagar's Khatauli area\n\n- 11 people have lost their lives till now and over 30 are said to be injured.\n\n- The incident took place around 5:50 pm.\n\n- Indian Railways released emergency helpline number for detail information.\n\n- Nine Uttar Pradesh Provincial Armed Constabulary (PAC) companies, a team of National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) and Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) have been rushed to the spot.\n\n- Medical vans have also been rushed to the site\n\n- Union Railway Minister Suresh Prabhu said that he has ordered inquiry into the unfortunate accident to ascertain the cause.\n\n- Railway Ministry and Uttar Pradesh Government are working hand in hand, informs Prabhu.\n\n- As per sources repair work was underway at the track.\n\n- MoS Railways Manoj Sinha and BJP leader Sanjeev Balyan are at the site.\n\n- Alternate arrangement is being made for stranded passengers.\n\n-Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik announced ex gratia of Rs 5 lakhs to the next kin of any Odia passengers killed in the incident. He also announced relief of Rs 50,000 for injured.\n\n- Union Minister of Railway Suresh Prabhu announced ex gratia of Rs 3.5 lakh for the next kin, Rs. 50, 000 for those seriously injured and Rs. 25, 000 for people with minor injuries.\n\n- President Ram Nath Kovind and Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday expressed condolences\n\n- Former chief minister of Uttar Pradesh Mulayam Singh Yadav and Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Raman Singh expressed condolences to the grieving kin of the victim. "2017-08-19", "title": "Big revelation in Utkal Exp tragedy", "storyUri": "eng-3374117", "extractedDates": null, "isDuplicate": false, "dateCrawl": "2017-08-19", "body": "At least 23 people were killed and 40 were injured as 14 of the 23 coaches of the Puri-Haridwar Kalinga Utkal Express derailed in Khatauli near Muzaffarnagar in Uttar Pradesh on Saturday.\n\nPrime Minister Narendra Modi said he was extremely pained by the derailment, while railways minister Suresh Prabhu said an inquiry has been ordered into the accident.\n\nThe total number of people injured in the accident that took place around 5.45pm was yet to be ascertained, officials said. Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath has rushed two ministers to the accident spot.\n\nThe train driver of the Kalinga Utkal Express applied sudden breaks as he spotted repair works on the tracks, leading to the derailment that killed at least 11 people and injured around 60 others on Saturday.\n\nUP's principal secretary (home) Arvind Kumar said the accident was caused by the sudden application of brakes.\n\n\"There was some work on the tracks, but no flagging was done,\" he told Hindustan Times. The Haridwar-bound Kalinga Utkal Express derailed in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar district on Saturday when the driver applied sudden brakes as some repair work was going on the tracks.\n\nBJP MLA from Khatauli, Vikram Singh Saini alleged conspiracy as repair work was on when the train was passing. Several people were reportedly injured but officials confirmed their numbers as 20. The figures are expected to go up. Witnesses said at least 20 bodies were taken out after cutting iron rods of the train's windows.\n\nRescue work is underway, with teams of the National Disaster Response Force being mobilised to add to the efforts. Railways have issued helpline numbers: 9760534045/5101 94106 09434, 0121-2604977, 94544 55183, 9410609434, 0121-2604977 Railway minister Suresh Prabhu ordered an inquiry into the derailment and promised strict action in case of lapse.\n\nHe said he was personally monitoring the situation and said that minister of state Manoj Sinha has rushed to the spot while the Railway Board chairman and member traffic have been asked to oversee rescue and relief operations. Chief minister Yogi Adityanath has ordered free treatment of all the injured.\n\nUP ministers Suresh Rana and Satish Mahana have been directed to rush to the site. Senior administration officials from Meerut and Muzaffarnagar have rushed to the spot. To check sabotage theory, additional director general of police (law and order) Anand Kumar rushed a team of anti-terrorist squad under deputy superintendent of police Anoop Singh to the site.\n\nVaranasi-based deputy commandant, NDRF, Devendra Kumar said, \"A team of 44 NDRF personnel equipped with rescue equipment have been rushed to the site from Ghaziabad.\" Since darkness was impeding rescue operations, the power department have been directed to ensure that there was no shortage of electricity.\n\nUP health minister Siddhharth Nath Singh tweeted that the government has mobilised medical services and instructed chief medical officers of Meerut and Muzaffarnagar to extend all help to the injured. Chief medical officer, Meerut, Dr Rajkumar stated that 26 government ambulances have been sent to the accident site for ferrying injured to hospitals in Meerut.\n\nAdditionally, 20 ambulances of private hospitals have also been rushed to the spot. Dr Rajkumar also informed that all hospitals, including the medical college in Meerut, have been put on high alert. Union minister Sanjeev Baliyan has reached spot.", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "16:33:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T16:33:00Z"}

Puri-Haridwar-Kalinga Utkal Express derails: List of train mishaps that took place in 2017US: Amtrak lead engine derails after crash near Philadelphia, 2 deadToy train derailment: Probe blames railway staff\n\nAt least 10 people were killed and over 50 others injured as six coaches of Puri-Haridwar Kalinga Utkal Express derailed in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar area on Saturday evening, ANI reported. Reflecting on the incident, Union Railway Minister Suresh Prabhu said he was personally monitoring the situation and that he has directed senior officials to take stock of the situation and ensure speedy rescue and relief operations.\n\nThe incident has occurred at Khatuali region. Meanwhile, Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has directed all possible help.\n\nREAD: Why trains derail: Explained by former Railways minister\n\nPuri-Haridwar-Kalinga Utkal Express derails: A look into train derailments that took place this year:\n\nApril 9, 2017: Goods train derails in West Bengal\n\nA goods train engine was derailed between Madpur and Jakpur in Howrah-Kharagpur section of South Eastern Railway. No casualties were reported in the incident. \"The engine derailed in the early hours today which affected railway traffic in up and down line,\" a railway spokesperson was quoted as saying by PTI. \"As a consequence of the derailment, movements of south India and Odisha bound long distance trains from Howrah were delayed and stranded at different stations,\" the spokesperson added. Read more here.\n\nMarch 30, 2017: Jabalpur-Nizamuddin Mahakaushal Express derails\n\nAt least 12 people were injured after eight coaches of the Jabalpur-Nizamuddin Mahakaushal Express derailed near Kulpahar railway station in Mahoba, Uttar Pradesh. Preliminary investigation suggested a weld failure in the rail led to the accident. The driver of the train told the railway officers that he felt a violent jerk when the train was running at 103 km per hour. It was the third train derailment in UP since November, last year. Read more here.\n\nMarch 17, 2017\n\nFour women were killed after a train rammed into an ambulance at an unmanned level crossing at Mannekote-Talaka road near Challakere in Chitradurga district in central Karnataka. The incident took place during the evening when few patients from the Talaka government hospital were being transferred to their villages in an ambulance. The ambulance driver could not judge the speed of the approaching train leading and tried to get through the crossing leading to the accident. The ambulance fell into a ditch when the train hit it's rear end. \"Three women Gangamma, 30, the mother of a newborn baby, Kadaramma aka Lakshmi, 50, and another 65-year old unidentified woman were killed at the spot. Another women succumbed at the Challakere hospital,\" the police had said. Read more here.\n\nFebruary 20, 2017\n\nThree coaches and the engine of Kalindi Express derailed after colliding with a goods train at the Tundla Junction in Uttar Pradesh. The train which runs between Kanpur Central and Bhiwani, Haryana was reportedly slow while entering the station thereby causing no injuries. The two trains - an express train and a freight train - were running on the same track and thus the express train rammed into the freight one from the back. Read more here.\n\nJanuary 22, 2017\n\nAt least 40 passengers were killed and over 50 were injured as nine coaches of Jagdalpur-Bhubaneswar Hirakhand Express derailed in Vizianagaram district of Andhra Pradesh on the night of January 21. The derailment was caused by a crack on rails. Andhra CM N Chandrababu Naidu had announced an ex gratia of Rs 5 lakh under an insurance scheme to the kin of passengers who were killed in the accident. Read more here.\n\nFor all the latest India News, download Indian Express App\n\nTags: derailment", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "15:05:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T15:05:00Z"}

"title": "Train derails in India killing many - in-cyprus.com", "storyUri": "eng-3374309", "extractedDates": null, "isDuplicate": false, "dateCrawl": "2017-08-19", "body": "A train came off the tracks in India's northern state of Uttar Pradesh on Saturday, killing at least 14 people and wounding dozens more as carriages slammed into each other, a local official said.\n\nTV channel CNN News18 put the death toll at 20 in the crash close to Muzaffarnagar, about 130 km north of the capital New Delhi. Local residents told the channel that some derailed carriages hit nearby houses.\n\nTrain crashes are frequent in India, which has the world's fourth biggest rail network. Poor investment in past decades in the vast network and rising demand means overcrowded trains are running on creaking infrastructure.\n\nSaturday's accident is at least the fourth major passenger train derailment this year and the third in Uttar Pradesh in 2017. A crash in November in Uttar Pradesh killed 150 people.\n\nSanjeev Balyan, a Muzaffarnagar lawmaker, told Reuters at least 14 people had been killed and 58 seriously injured, after a local medical officer had previously put the death toll at 11.\n\nRelated stories:\n\nLocal television channels showed chaotic scenes at the crash site, with rescuers trying find the injured amid crowds of people gathered around overturned carriages. At least five carriages had come off the tracks.\n\n\"We are struggling to pull out injured, and are waiting for gas cutters to arrive. It's too dark to launch a full fledged search operation, but our teams are trying their best,\" said Ajay Pandey, a senior police officer at the site.\n\nThe national authorities have sent disaster teams to help.\n\nIndian Prime Minister Narendra Modi sent a message on Twitter saying he was pained by the derailment of the Utkal Express, offering condolences to families of those killed and wishing a speedy recovery to the injured.\n\nIn June, Reuters reported that a planned $15 billion safety overhaul of India's rail network was facing delays as the state steel company could not meet demand for new rails.\n\nThe network is in the middle of a $130 billion, five-year modernisation. The government launched the additional safety overhaul programme in February to tackle a surge in train accidents in the past two years blamed on defective tracks", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "16:28:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T16:28:00Z"}

"textEnd": 621, "date": "-11-20", "textStart": 610}], "isDuplicate": false, "dateCrawl": "2017-08-19", "body": "Earlier, a similar probe was launched after Kanpur train tragedy which took place in the month of November last year.\n\nActing early in Puri Haridwar Kalinga Utkal Express derailment incident, Uttar Pradesh Anti-Terror Squad reached the accident spot within hours and started probing the terror angle in the accident, ABP News reported. Earlier, a similar probe was launched after Kanpur train tragedy which took place in the month of November last year. The police had suspected that Pakistan spy agency ISI might be behind the tragedy that claimed the lives of at least 140 people and injured many others, on November 20.\n\nNews agency ANI reported that at least 5 people have been killed in the accident which took place in Khatauli, a town which about 40 km away from Muzaffarnagar of Uttar Pradesh. The report says that at least six coaches went off track and over 30 people have been reported injured in the incident. The train was going to en-route to Puri with its arrival time scheduled at 9 PM. The incident took place at around 6:45 PM.\n\nLIVE: Puri Haridwar Kalinga Utkal Express derails in Khatauli in Muzaffarnagar\n\nTweeting about the incident, Railway Minister Suresh Prabhu said that medical vans have been rushed to the site and he is personally monitoring the situation. \"Have instructed Chairman Rly Board, Member Traffic to oversee rescue, relief operations; I'm personally monitoring situation\" Suresh Prabhu tweeted. \"Medical vans have been rushed to the site; all efforts being taken to ensure speedy relief and rescue operations,\" Prabhu added.\n\nAs per ABP News, at least 20 people have been admitted to the hospital but the unofficial figure must be much more. The reason behind the accident is still not clear yet. The rescue operations are currently going on and the number of injured people might go up. Directions issued for all possible assistance.\" (Source: ANI) Amit Shah resigns as MLA, says Congress will be reduced to half in next pollsNitish Kumar targets Sharad Yadav, asks why didn't he stop JD(U) split from NDA in 2013Puducherry Lt Governor Kiran Bedi goes incognito, conducts midnight patrolling to assess women safety\n\nAt least 20 passengers were feared injured when nearly six coaches of the Puri-Haridwar Utkal Express derailed in Khatauli on Saturday evening, officials said. Meerut Zone ADG Prashant Kumar said the number of injured persons was yet to be ascertained. Meanwhile, Railway ministry officials said they are still awaiting details of the accident that took place around 5:45 pm. Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has directed all possible help. Television visuals show derailed coaches have crashed into a house. Local administration officials have reached the spot and rescue operations are underway, officials in Delhi said.\n\nHere are the top developments so far:\n\n1. The Utkal Express derailment is likely to affect movement of trains on the busy Northern Railway route.\n\nUtkal Express train derails in Muzaffarnagar\n\n2. Railway minister Suresh Prabhu orders inquiry to ascertain cause of Utkal Express derailment, says strict action against any lapse.\n\n3. Utkal Express train derailment: MoS for Railways, Manoj Sinha to visit the accident site with seniors officers, tweeted Suresh Prabhu.\n\n4. No authentic information on casualties yet; trying our best to mobilise resources for rescue, relief ops, said Railways spokesperson Anil Saxena.\n\n5. Medical vans rushed to site; all efforts being made to ensure speedy relief and rescue operations: Suresh Prabhu\n\n6. "Four passengers were killed and at least 20 injured when 14 coaches of the Puri-Haridwar Utkal Express derailed in Khatauli near here this evening, officials said.\n\nThe casualty figure might go up.\n\nRailways spokesperson Anil Saxena put the number of dead at four and the injured at 20.\n\nThe accident took place around 5:45 pm. Khatauli is around 40 km from Muzaffarnagar. Television visuals show that derailed bogies have crashed into a house.\n\nRailway Minister Suresh Prabhu ordered an inquiry into the derailment. He said he was personally monitoring the situation and strict action will be taken in case of any lapse.\n\nIn a series of tweets, Prabhu also said that Minister of State Manoj Sinha has rushed to the spot while the Chairman of Railway Board and Member Traffic have been asked to oversee rescue and relief operations.\n\nTwo National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) teams, comprising 45 personnel each, and two canines have been mobilised to the accident site from their base in Ghaziabad.\n\nMedical vans have also been rushed to the site.\n\n\"All efforts being taken to ensure speedy relief and rescue operations,\" Prabhu said.\n\nThe Railway Ministry was also in close touch with the Uttar Pradesh government to coordinate rescue and relief operations.\n\nIn Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh ADG (Law and Order) Anand Kumar said that top priority was being accorded to ensure prompt rescue and relief work.\n\nHe said PAC and NDRF teams have been rushed to the spot.\n\nSince darkness was impeding rescue operations, he said the power department officials had been directed to ensure that there was no shortage of electricity.\n\nKumar also said IMA chapters in Meerut zone have been alerted and asked to ensure adequate and prompt medical care to the injured.\n\nUttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath enquired about the accident and directed officials to take all possible action, an official spokesperson said.\n\nAdityanath has directed two of his ministers to reach the site to expedite rescue and relief operations.\n\n(This article has not been edited by DNA's editorial team and is auto-generated from an agency feed.)", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "15:01:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T15:01:00Z"}

As nighttime falls in Khatauli, relief operations are becoming even more difficult to execute.\n\n#UPTrainTragedy -- Eyewitnesses say there is no electricity at the accident site, which is hampering relief operations. pic.twitter.com/CxjmQCNzqd -- News18 (@CNNnews18)\n\nAugust 19, 2017\n\n19:36 (IST)\n\nSuresh Prabhu says that Minister of State in the Ministry of Railways Manoj Sinha is also reaching the site of the incident\n\n.@manojsinhabjp and I am monitoring the unfortunate accident,he is rushing to the accident site with member traffic and other sr officers -- Suresh Prabhu (@sureshpprabhu)\n\nAugust 19, 2017\n\n19:33 (IST)\n\nThree bogeys still not accessible to rescue teams\n\nAccording to CNN-News18, eyewitnesses at the scene say that rescue workers have still not been able to access three bogeys that crashed at the far end of the station. To make matters worse, at least 300-400 people are reportedly still trapped in the coaches.\n\n19:30 (IST)\n\nHere's a look at train accidents in the last 15 months\n\nThe year 2016 witnessed some major train accidents, and 2017 continues on a grim note as well, with a major derailment at Khatauli district in Uttar Pradesh. Here are the details of the major train accidents so far.\n\n19:26 (IST)\n\nMinister of State for Petroleum and Natural Gas Dharmendra Pradhan sends his condolences\n\nDeeply pained by the news of derailment of #UtkalExpress at Khatauli near #Muzaffarnagar. derailment\n\n\u0909\u0924\u094d\u0924\u0930 \u092a\u094d\u0930\u0926\u0947\u0936 \u0915\u0947 \u091c\u0928\u092a\u0926 \u092e\u0941\u091c\u092b\u094d\u092b\u0930\u0928\u0917\u0930 \u092e\u0947\u0902 (IST)\n\nRescue operations gear up in Muzaffarnagar\n\nThe Chief Public Relation Officers of Northern Railways has said that the District magistrate of Muzaffarnagar is about to reach the site of the train derailment. The first NDRF team with 44 rescuers and two search dogs have also reached the spot according to ANI. Suresh Prabhu has tweeted again, saying, \"Strict action will be taken against any lapse.\" CNN-News18 reports that a medical train is also en route to the location to help.\n\n19:09 (IST)\n\nSuresh Prabhu tweets about Kalinga Utkal Express derailment\n\nMinister for Railways Suresh Prabhu spoke about the derailment of the Kalinga Utkal Express, saying that he is personally monitoring the situation. He adds that In close touch with Yogi Adityanath and district administration to coordinate rescue and relief operations.\n\nI am personally monitoring situation.Hv instructed senior officers to reach site immediately and ensure speedy rescue and relief operations https://t.co/OCpgUGhg5y -- Suresh Prabhu (@sureshpprabhu)\n\nAugust 19, 2017\n\nMedical vans have been rushed to the site.All efforts being taken to ensure speedy relief and rescue operations -- Suresh Prabhu (@sureshpprabhu)\n\nAugust 19, 2017\n\nHave instructed Chairman Rly Board,Member Traffic to oversee rescue and relief operations.I am personally monitoring situation -- Suresh Prabhu (@sureshpprabhu)\n\nAugust 19, 2017\n\nInstructed General Manager, other senior officers to ensure all possible help to the people -- Suresh Prabhu (@sureshpprabhu)\n\nAugust 19, 2017\n\n18:57 (IST)\n\nRailway spokesperson speaks on the derailment\n\nRailway spokesperson Anil Saxena said that the 18447 train headed for Puri met with the accident at Khatauli in Uttar Pradesh. He said that the Delhi division of Northern Railways is addressing the accident and that senior officials of the Delhi division have rushed to the site. Ambulances have also reached the location and NDRF teams are on their way\n\n18:54 (IST)\n\nFive dead in Utkal Express derailment\n\nAccording to CNN-News18, some of the bogies from the Utkal Express have entered the residences of people living around the railway tracks, so it is feared that more people might be injured. The report states that the death toll stands at five as of now. The accident, that took place at 5.46 pm, occurred at a densely populated area, adding further complications to the rescue operations that could happen overnight, according to officials. The report states that not six, but 10 coaches have in fact been derailed. Hence, there are conflicting reports of the number of coaches affected in the derailment.\n\n18:49 (IST)\n\nNDRF teams mobilized for rescue operation at Khatauli railway station in Muzaffarnagar, reports ANI\n\n18:44 (IST)\n\nRescue and relief teams sent from Muzzafarnagar and Meerut\n\nAuthorities say focus remains on rescue and relief work. Times Now states that the trains were operating on really high speed, which led to one bogey getting crashed above another. The report adds that Khatauli might not have the medical capacity to handle those injured, hence medical resources are being sent in from Muzzafarnagar and Meerut. Since the town is not very far from the capital, railway authorities might be able to send assistance from Delhi as well.\n\n18:40 (IST)\n\nTimes Now reports that more than 20 individuals have been injured in the accident, reports yet to arrive on casualties.\n\n18:36 (IST)\n\nSix coaches of Puri-Haridwar-Kalinga Utkal Express derail in Khatauli town in Muzaffarnagar, reports ANI\n\nUttar Pradesh: Six coaches of Puri-Haridwar-Kalinga Utkal Express derail in Muzaffarnagar's Khatauli pic.twitter.com/KBxd9NytBf -- ANI UP (@ANINewsUP)\n\nAugust 19, 2017\n\nSix coaches of the Utkal Express derailed on Saturday evening in Muzaffarnagar's Khatauli in Uttar Pradesh injuring at least 20 people although officials say that casualty figures could go higher given the intensity of the incident.\n\nA train derailed in Khatauli town in Muzaffarnagar. Twitter @ANI\n\nOfficial casualty figures have not been released so far as the senior officials of the Muzaffarnagar district administration have rushed to the spot to supervise relief and rescue operations, media reports say. The Uttra Pradesh government has also sought for Central assistance to expedite the rescue and relief operations.\n\nThe ill-fated train was headed from Puri in Odisha to Haridwar in Uttarakhand.\n\nFinancial Express reported that the incident took place around 6.45 pm. The report further mentioned that the reason behind the derailment is still unclear.\n\nNo passengers have been reported dead thus far. According to the Financial Express, \"The rescue operations are currently going on and the number of injured people might go up. The locals have reached the spot are helping with the relief operations.\"\n\nThe Times of India reported that the local administration officials have reached the site of the incident. The derailment is likely to affect the movements of trains along the busy Northern Railway route.\n\nWith inputs from IANS\n\nPublished Date: Aug 19, 2017 07:29 pm | Updated Date: Aug 19, 2017 08:02 pm\n\nTags :#Accident#Derail#Kalinga utkal express\u202c#Newstracker#Train#Utkal express#Uttar pradesh#\u202aharidwar\u202c#\u202akhatauli\u202c#\u202amuzaffarnagar\u202c#\u202apuri\u202c#\u202auttar pradesh\u202c\u202c", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "14:32:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T14:32:00Z"}

"date": "2017-08-19", "title": "Kalinga Utkal Express derails in Muzaffarnagar: Death toll reaches 23, scores injured, govt begins inquiry", "storyUri": "eng-3374117", "extractedDates": null, "isDuplicate": false, "dateCrawl": "2017-08-19", "body": "At least 23 people were killed and 40 injured when 14 coaches of the Kalinga Utkal Express derailed in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar district on Saturday, sending coaches ramming into each other as well as a house close to the tracks.\n\nThe train from Puri in Odisha was on its way to Haridwar in Uttarakhand. It derailed near Khatauli station around 5.45pm.\n\nUP principal secretary (home), Arvind Kumar, said the train got derailed as the driver slammed the brakes suddenly. \"There was (repair) work on the tracks but no flagging was done,\" he added.\n\nRailway sources denied the charge.\n\nThe driver \"felt a jerk and realised that the derailment had happened. He couldn't apply the brakes\", one of the sources said.\n\n\"According to him, either the soil beneath the tracks was loose because of the rain or the railways didn't do periodic ultrasonic fault detection on the tracks,\" the source added.\n\nThe train was travelling at 106kmph. It normally covers the distance between Puri and Haridwar in 36 hours.\n\nThe engine and five bogies apparently crossed the spot where the train derailed.\n\nA team of UP's anti-terrorist squad was sent to the site to investigate if it was a case of sabotage or not.\n\nRailway minister Suresh Prabhu ordered an inquiry and directed railway board chairman and other officials to oversee rescue and relief operations. \"I am personally monitoring the situation,\" he tweeted.\n\nHe also announced an ex gratia of Rs 3.5 lakh for the dead and Rs 50,000 for those with serious injuries.\n\nThe railways have issued helpline numbers: 9760534045/5101 94106 09434, 0121-2604977, 94544 55183, 9410609434, 0121-2604977.\n\nPrime Minister Narendra Modi expressed condolences over the deaths.\n\n\"Extremely pained by the derailment of the Utkal Express in Muzaffarnagar. My thoughts are with the families of the deceased,\" he said in a tweet.\n\nUttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath ordered free treatment and directed ministers Suresh Rana and Satish Mahana to reach the site.\n\nOdisha chief minister Naveen Patnaik announced Rs 5 lakh ex gratia to the kin of Odia passengers killed in the accident and Rs 50,000 for the injured.\n\nUnion minister Sanjeev Baliyan, who represents Muzaffarnagar in Lok Sabha, reached the spot soon after the accident.\n\nTwo bogies of the train rammed into the house of Pintu Choudhary, eyewitness Sandeep Rodhia said, adding that five people, including a tea stall owner, were crushed by the bogies.\n\nCranes and gas-cutters were used to lift and cut the mangled coaches and extricate passengers. More than 20 bodies were taken out.\n\nLocal people assisted the rescue. Rizwan, a photo studio owner in Muzaffarnagar, said: \"I took out 18 bodies.\"\n\nA team of 44 NDRF personnel, equipped with rescue equipment, and 12 companies of PAC were sent to the spot for rescue.\n\nSenior administration officials from Meerut and Muzaffarnagar also were at the spot.\n\nChief medical officer, Meerut, Dr Rajkumar said 26 government ambulances and 20 private ones were sent to the accident site for ferrying the injured to hospitals in Meerut.\n\nHe said all hospitals in Meerut were asked to keep emergency and critical wards prepared for the injured.\n\nA separate 50-bed ward has been prepared for treatment of the mishap victims. A team of health officials from Meerut also rushed to the accident site.\n\nLeaves of doctors of all government hospitals in Meerut have been cancelled with immediate effect. The commissioner has issued orders for all government doctors to report to their respective hospitals at the earliest.\n\nThe rescue operation was complete around midnight, and all the injured hospitalised, railway minister Suresh Prabhu tweeted.", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "20:10:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T20:10:00Z"}

recent derailment of the Puri-Haridwar-Kalinga Utkal Express, near Khatauli railway station in Muzaffarnagar and accused the Centre for being careless regarding the safety of the passengers travelling with the Indian Railways which has claimed so many lives in past three years.\n\n?Since Modi Govt took over in May 2014, 259 passengers have lost their lives & 899 injured in 27 train accidents. When will Govt wake up?,? Congress leader Randeep Surjewala told ANI.\n\nSurjewala further said that the railway safety still remains under the cloud of question mark with such accidents taking place at continuous basis.\n\n?If Prime Minister Modi can spend Rs 1 lakh crore on a bullet train, which he promised between Ahmadabad and Mumbai, why can?t he allocate 40 thousand crore for railway safety. We have seen platform tickets go up. We have seen, passengers fare go up, but railway safety remains under a serious cloud,? he told ANI.\n\nFurther stressing on the same, Surjewala requested the government to wake up from their sleep and take some action after taking lessons from this incident.\n\n?We sincerely hope and request the government to at least wake up from its slumber taking a lesson from this painful train accident in Muzaffarnagar and ensure that adequate time bound measures are taken for the railway safety,? he said.\n\nSurjewala said that no amount of compensation and money can bring back the lives of those who have died.\n\n?Important question is how they are going to prevent such incidents from happening in future. What steps have they taken and lesson learnt from such incident,? he added.\n\nHere are the updates so far:\n\n- Fourteen coaches of Puri-Haridwar-Kalinga Utkal Express derailed in Muzaffarnagar's Khatauli area\n\n- 23 people have lost their lives till now and 40 are said to be injured.\n\n- The incident took place around 5:50 pm.\n\n- Indian Railways released emergency helpline number for detail information.\n\n- Nine Uttar Pradesh Provincial Armed Constabulary (PAC) companies, a team of National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) and Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) have been rushed to the spot.\n\n- Medical vans have also been rushed to the site\n\n- Union Railway Minister Suresh Prabhu said that he has ordered inquiry into the unfortunate accident to ascertain the cause.\n\n- Railway Ministry and Uttar Pradesh Government are working hand in hand, informs Prabhu.\n\n- As per sources repair work was underway at the track.\n\n- MoS Railways Manoj Sinha and BJP leader Sanjeev Balyan are at the site.\n\n- Alternate arrangement is being made for stranded passengers.\n\n-Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik announced ex gratia of Rs 5 lakhs to the next kin of any Odia passengers killed in the incident. He also announced relief of Rs 50,000 for injured.\n\n- Union Minister of Railway Suresh Prabhu announced ex gratia of Rs 3.5 lakh for the next kin, Rs. 50,000 for those seriously injured and Rs. 25, 000 for people with minor injuries.\n\n- Former chief minister of Uttar Pradesh Mulayam Singh Yadav and Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Raman Singh expressed condolences to the grieving kin of the victim.\n\n- President Ram Nath Kovind and Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed condolences to the grieving kin of the victims who lost their lives in the derailment of the Puri-Haridwar-Kalinga Utkal Express.\n\n- Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath said that he has sent two of his ministers to the accident spot to take a stock of the situation.\n\n(This article has not been edited by DNA's editorial team and is auto-generated from an agency feed.)", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "17:07:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T17:07:00Z"}

"2017-08-19", "body": "Lucknow: At least 20 people were injured after six coaches of the Utkal Express derailed near Khatauli in Uttar Pradesh, officials said.\n\nAccording to railway officials, the incident occurred around 5:46 PM in Khatauli, in Muzaffarnagar district.\n\nThe train was headed from Puri in Odisha to Haridwar in Uttarakhand.\n\nNorthern Railways spokesperson Neeraj Sharma told IANS, \"Six coaches of the train derailed in which over 20 passengers have been injured.\"\n\nHe said the railways has rushed medical vans to the site and rescue operations are underway.\n\nRailways Minister Suresh Prabhu said he was personally monitoring the situation and a probe has been ordered.\n\n\"I am personally monitoring situation. Strict action will be taken against any lapse,\" he said.\n\nThe Minister said that medical vans have been rushed to the site. "title": "259 killed in 27 train accidents under Modi Govt.: Congress", "storyUri": "eng-3374117", "extractedDates": [{"amb": false, "textEnd": 16, "date": "2017-08-19", "imp": true, "textStart": 9}, {"amb": false, "textEnd": 441, "date": "2014-05-", "textStart": 433}], "isDuplicate": false, "dateCrawl": "2017-08-19", "body": "[India], Aug. 19 (ANI): The Congress Party on Saturday launched a scathing attack on Prime Minister Narendra Modi over the recent derailment of the Puri-Haridwar-Kalinga Utkal Express, near Khatauli railway station in Muzaffarnagar and accused the Centre for being careless regarding the safety of the passengers travelling with the Indian Railways which has claimed so many lives in past three years.\n\n\"Since Modi Govt took over in May 2014, 259 passengers have lost their lives & 899 injured in 27 train accidents. When will Govt wake up?,\" Congress leader Randeep Surjewala told ANI.\n\nSurjewala further said that the railway safety still remains under the cloud of question mark with such accidents taking place at continuous basis.\n\n\"If Prime Minister Modi can spend Rs 1 lakh crore on a bullet train, which he promised between Ahmadabad and Mumbai, why can't he allocate 40 thousand crore for railway safety. We have seen platform tickets go up. We have seen, passengers fare go up, but railway safety remains under a serious cloud,\" he told ANI.\n\nFurther stressing on the same, Surjewala requested the government to wake up from their sleep and take some action after taking lessons from this incident.\n\n\"We sincerely hope and request the government to at least wake up from its slumber taking a lesson from this painful train accident in Muzaffarnagar and ensure that adequate time bound measures are taken for the railway safety,\" he said.\n\nSurjewala said that no amount of compensation and money can bring back the lives of those who have died.\n\n\"Important question is how they are going to prevent such incidents from happening in future. What steps have they taken and lesson learnt from such incident,\" he added.\n\nHere are the updates so far:\n\n- Fourteen coaches of Puri-Haridwar-Kalinga Utkal Express derailed in Muzaffarnagar's Khatauli area\n\n- 23 people have lost their lives till now and 40 are said to be injured.\n\n- The incident took place around 5:50 pm.\n\n- Indian Railways released emergency helpline number for detail information.\n\n- Nine Uttar Pradesh Provincial Armed Constabulary (PAC) companies, a team of National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) and Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) have been rushed to the spot.\n\n- Medical vans have also been rushed to the site\n\n- Union Railway Minister Suresh Prabhu said that he has ordered inquiry into the unfortunate accident to ascertain the cause.\n\n- Railway Ministry and Uttar Pradesh Government are working hand in hand, informs Prabhu.\n\n- As per sources repair work was underway at the track.\n\n- MoS Railways Manoj Sinha and BJP leader Sanjeev Balyan are at the site.\n\n- Alternate arrangement is being made for stranded passengers.\n\n-Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik announced ex gratia of Rs 5 lakhs to the next kin of any Odia passengers killed in the incident. He also announced relief of Rs 50,000 for injured.\n\n- Union Minister of Railway Suresh Prabhu announced ex gratia of Rs 3.5 lakh for the next kin, Rs. 50,000 for those seriously injured and Rs. 25, 000 for people with minor injuries.\n\n- Former chief minister of Uttar Pradesh Mulayam Singh Yadav and Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Raman Singh expressed condolences to the grieving kin of the victim.\n\n- President Ram Nath Kovind and Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed condolences to the grieving kin of the victims who lost their lives in the derailment of the Puri-Haridwar-Kalinga Utkal Express.\n\n- Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath said that he has sent two of his ministers to the accident spot to take a stock of the situation. "extractedDates": null, "isDuplicate": false, "dateCrawl": "2017-08-19", "body": "PM Modi sends condolences as at 23 killed and scores injured after train connecting Haridwar and Puri comes off tracks.\n\nAt least 23 passengers were killed and 64 others injured after an express train derailed in north India, officials said, as rescuers attempted to free people trapped in the wreckage.\n\nThe accident took place near Khatauli in the state of Uttar Pradesh, about 100km northeast of the national capital, New Delhi.\n\n\"Twenty-three people have died and 64 others are injured in the accident. Rescue and relief operations are continuing,\" G S Priyadarshi, a civil official at the accident site, told AFP.\n\nThe injured were taken to a hospital, where doctors described their condition as stable.\n\nREAD MORE: Dozens killed after train derails in southern India\n\nCranes lifted derailed coaches and gas cutters were used to reach people feared to be trapped, the IANS news agency reported.\n\nRailway police and local volunteers were seen trying to help passengers out of the upturned coaches of the Kalinga-Utkal Express, which connects the Hindu holy city of Haridwar with the temple town of Puri, in the eastern state of Orissa.\n\nThe cause of the derailment was not immediately known, Sharma said.\n\nRailway Minister Suresh Prabhu ordered an inquiry into the train derailment.\n\n\"Strict action will be taken against any lapse,\" he tweeted. \"I am personally monitoring the situation. Have instructed senior officers to reach the site immediately and ensure speedy rescue and relief operations.\"\n\nThe minister has announced a compensation of $5,500 for the kin of deceased passengers.\n\nIndian Prime Minister Narendra Modi said on Twitter he was pained by the accident, offered condolences to families of those killed, and wished a speedy recovery to the injured.\n\nTrain accidents are common in India, where more than 22 million passengers use the rail system daily.\n\nSaturday's accident is at least the fourth major passenger train derailment this year and the third in Uttar Pradesh in 2017.\n\nOver 250 people were killed across the country in train accidents in 2015 and 2016.\n\nIn November, a crash in Uttar Pradesh killed 150 people.\n\nIn June, Reuters reported that a planned $15bn safety overhaul of India's rail network faced delays as the state steel company could not meet demand for new rails.\n\nThe network is in the middle of a $130bn, five-year modernisation.\n\nThe government launched the additional safety overhaul programme in February to tackle a surge in train accidents in the past two years blamed on defective tracks.", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "19:17:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T19:17:00Z"}

"2017-08-19", "body": "Several people have been injured, rescue operation is underway. Picture courtesy Twitter\n\nAt least Five people were feared killed and over 50 others, including women and children, were injured, when Haridwar bound Utkal Express train derailed in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar district, about 500 kilometres from here, on Saturday.\n\nEyewitness accounts claimed that five passengers were killed in the mishap. Additional director general of UP police, law and order, Anand Kumar told reporters here that a large number of passengers were injured in the mishap. He also said that some people had been killed but refused to specify the number of casualties.\n\nUnion minister Sanjiv Baliyan, who hailed from Muzaffarnagar, said that all the injured have been admitted to hospitals. Baliyan said that some passengers were killed in the mishap.\n\n''There may be five..six...ten dead....passengers are still trapped in side the coaches,'', he added.\n\nPolice sources here said that the mishap occurred near Khatauli railway station, which 22 kilometres from the district headquarters, around six in the evening. The train was scheduled to reach Haridwar, a pilgrimage town in Uttarakhand around nine in the evening.\n\nSources said that six coaches of the train, which was on its way to Haridwar in Uttarakhand from Puri in Odisha, derailed near the outer cabin near Khatauli. One of the coaches also rammed into the houses, which were close to the railway tracks.\n\nOfficials said that medical teams had been rushed to the spot from Meerut, Saharanpur and other nearby districts. Ambulances have also been rushed to the spot, sources said.\n\nThe injured were admitted to the nearby hospitals in Meerut and Muzaffarnagar, the officials said adding that hospitals in the NCR region had been put on alert following the mishap. Some of the injured were stated to be in a critical condition.\n\nSources quoting eye witnesses said that some of the derailed coaches had climbed on other coaches. Gas cutters were being pressed into service to cut through the mangled coaches to pull out the passengers, who were trapped inside the derailed coaches.\n\nSources said that over one hundred passengers were pulled out of the derailed coaches so far. Locals were the first ones to reach the spot and rescue the passengers.\n\nNDRF team had also rushed to the spot to assist in the relief and rescue operations, officials here said.\n\nOfficials here said that the Anti-Terrorist Squad (ATS) team of the UP police had also rushed to the spot to investigate if sabotage was behind the mishap.", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "14:48:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T14:48:00Z"}

coaches of the Puri-Haridwar Kalinga Utkal Express derailed in Khatauli near Muzaffarnagar in Uttar Pradesh on\u2009Saturday.\n\nThe number of injured persons was yet to be ascertained, officials said. However, eyewitnesses said at least 20 people were wounded in the accident that took place around 5.45pm.\n\nLive updates:\n\n8.06pm: Yogi Adityanath says exact casualties not known yet. \"Our two ministers Satish Mahana and Suresh Rana have been sent to the spot.\"\n\n8.05pm: UP CM Yogi Adityanath calls it an \"unfortunate incident\". \"We are in constant touch with the rail ministry,\" he says.\n\n8pm: More than 50 injured. ATS sent there as a precautionary measure, no confirmation of terrorism angle, says ADG (law and order) Anand Kumar.\n\n7.56pm: Anil Saxena, spokesperson of Indian Railways, says four people confirmed dead in the train derailment.\n\n7.55pm: Suresh Prabhu says he has spoken to UP CM Yogi Adityanath, who has directed two UP ministers also to reach the site to expedite rescue and relief operations\n\n7.45pm: How will people travel, there is no guarantee of safety. Railway minister should resign, says Lalu Prasad.\n\n7.40pm: Two teams from the NDRF headquarters, comprising 45 personnel each, and two canines rushed to the accident site from their base in Ghaziabad.\n\n7.37pm: Union minister Sanjeev Baliyan reaches accident site.\n\n7.35pm: Suresh Prabhu says he has ordered an inquiry into the accident to ascertain the cause. Strict action will be taken against any lapse.\n\n7.30pm: Meerut chief medical officer Dr Rajkumar says 26 government ambulances sent to the spot and the injured are being taken to hospitals in Meerut . 20 additional ambulances of private hospitals are also sent on the spot.\n\n7.22pm: Locals involved in rescue work. Eyewitness claim at least 20 bodies of passengers have been taken out from the crushed bogies after cutting the iron rods of windows.\n\n7.20pm: UP health minister Siddharthnath Singh says medical services have been mobilised and he has instructed Meerut and Muzaffarnagar officials to ensure all help is extended to the injured.\n\n7.16pm: Northern Railways CPRO Neeraj Sharma says alternative vehicles are being arranged for stranded passengers.\n\n7.15pm: Railway minister Suresh Prabhu says he is personally monitoring the situation and has instructed senior officers to reach the site and ensure speedy rescue and relief operations.\n\n7.11pm: Trains for Hardwar and Dehradun are being diverted through Shamli.\n\n7.10pm: Dr Kirti Dubey, principal of Meerut Medical College, said preparations are being made in orthopaedics and surgery departments to treat the injured. Private hospitals have also been put on alert.\n\n7.06pm: A team from the UP Anti-Terror Squad rushes to the spot from Lucknow. ATS deputy superintendent Anoop Singh is leading the team.\n\n#WATCH: Visuals from the train derailment site in Muzaffarnagar's Khatauli; 6 coaches have derailed. More details awaited #UttarPradesh pic.twitter.com/AiNdfKV7oS -- ANI UP (@ANINewsUP)\n\nAugust 19, 2017\n\n7.05pm: A team of railway officials and National Disaster Response Force rush to the spot from Meerut and Muzzafarnagar for rescue operations.\n\n7.04pm: The train was travelling from Puri in Odisha towards Haridwar in Uttarakhand.\n\n7.03pm: Officials said six coaches of the Utkal Express jumped off the tracks near Jagatpur colony of Khataulli, 40 km from Meerut town.\n\n7pm: Television visuals show derailed coaches have crashed into a house.\n\nLocal administration officials have reached the spot and rescue operations are underway, officials in Delhi said.\n\n6:45pm:\u2009The derailment is likely to affect movement of trains on the busy Northern Railway route.", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "14:48:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T14:48:00Z"}

Have directed Principal Secretary (Home) Arvind Kumar to get in touch with the Muzaffarnagar District Magistrate to supervise the relief and rescue operations,\" CM Yogi Adityanath said.\n\nSpeaking about the number of casualties in the mishap, CM Adityanath said that 'there are no official reports of casualties at this point of time'.\n\nAlso Read: 10 killed, over 50 injured after 14 coaches of Utkal Express derail in UP's Khatauli\n\n\"Our two ministers Satish Mahana and Suresh Rana have been sent to the spot to take stock of the situation,\" the CM added further.\n\nAt least 10 people have been killed and more than 50 are said to have been injured after several coaches of Utkal Express derailed in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar area on Saturday evening.\n\nThe incident took place at Khatuali region in Muzaffarnagar. "2017-08-19", "body": "[India], Aug. 19 (ANI): Rescue operations are over and restoration works have begun following the deadly Puri-Haridwar-Kalinga Utkal Express derailment, which has claimed 23 lives so far.\n\nThis was informed by Union Railway Minister Suresh Prabhu, who also announced an ex gratia of Rs 3.5 lakh for the kin of those who have been killed, Rs. 50 thousand for those who are seriously injured and Rs. 25 thousand for people with minor injuries.\n\n\"Rescue operations have been completed. All injured shifted to hospital. Restoration work will start now. Still monitoring situation closely,\" Prabhu tweeted.\n\nHere are the updates in the tragedy so far:\n\n- Fourteen coaches of Puri-Haridwar-Kalinga Utkal Express derailed in Muzaffarnagar's Khatauli area.\n\n- 23 people have lost their lives till now and 40 are said to be injured.\n\n- The incident took place around 5:50 pm.\n\n- Indian Railways released emergency helpline number for detail information.\n\n- Nine Uttar Pradesh Provincial Armed Constabulary (PAC) companies, a team of National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) and Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) have been rushed to the spot.\n\n- Medical vans have also been rushed to the site\n\n- Union Railway Minister Suresh Prabhu said that he has ordered inquiry into the unfortunate accident to ascertain the cause.\n\n- Railway Ministry and Uttar Pradesh Government are working hand in hand, informs Prabhu.\n\n- As per sources repair work was underway at the track.\n\n- MoS Railways Manoj Sinha and BJP leader Sanjeev Balyan are at the site.\n\n- Alternate arrangement is being made for stranded passengers.\n\n-Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik announced ex gratia of Rs 5 lakhs to the next kin of any Odia passengers killed in the incident. He also announced relief of Rs 50,000 for injured.\n\n- Union Minister of Railway Suresh Prabhu announced ex gratia of Rs 3.5 lakh for the next kin, Rs. 50, 000 for those seriously injured and Rs. 25, 000 for people with minor injuries.\n\n-President Ram Nath Kovind and Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday expressed condolences\n\n- Former chief minister of Uttar Pradesh Mulayam Singh Yadav and Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Raman Singh expressed condolences to the grieving kin of the victim.\n\n- Union Health Minister JP Nadda asked central trauma care teams to remain on standby.\n\n- Repair work was underway at the track during derailment, say sources.
