Railways which has claimed so many lives in past three years.\n\n?Since Modi Govt took over in May 2014, 259 passengers have lost their lives & 899 injured in 27 train accidents. When will Govt wake up?,? Congress leader Randeep Surjewala told ANI.\n\nSurjewala further said that the railway safety still remains under the cloud of question mark with such accidents taking place at continuous basis.\n\n?If Prime Minister Modi can spend Rs 1 lakh crore on a bullet train, which he promised between Ahmadabad and Mumbai, why can?t he allocate 40 thousand crore for railway safety. We have seen platform tickets go up. We have seen, passengers fare go up, but railway safety remains under a serious cloud,? he told ANI.\n\nFurther stressing on the same, Surjewala requested the government to wake up from their sleep and take some action after taking lessons from this incident.\n\n?We sincerely hope and request the government to at least wake up from its slumber taking a lesson from this painful train accident in Muzaffarnagar and ensure that adequate time bound measures are taken for the railway safety,? he said.\n\nSurjewala said that no amount of compensation and money can bring back the lives of those who have died.\n\n?Important question is how they are going to prevent such incidents from happening in future. What steps have they taken and lesson learnt from such incident,? he added.\n\nHere are the updates so far:\n\n- Fourteen coaches of Puri-Haridwar-Kalinga Utkal Express derailed in Muzaffarnagar's Khatauli area\n\n- 23 people have lost their lives till now and 40 are said to be injured.\n\n- The incident took place around 5:50 pm.\n\n- Indian Railways released emergency helpline number for detail information.\n\n- Nine Uttar Pradesh Provincial Armed Constabulary (PAC) companies, a team of National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) and Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) have been rushed to the spot.\n\n- Medical vans have also been rushed to the site\n\n- Union Railway Minister Suresh Prabhu said that he has ordered inquiry into the unfortunate accident to ascertain the cause.\n\n- Railway Ministry and Uttar Pradesh Government are working hand in hand, informs Prabhu.\n\n- As per sources repair work was underway at the track.\n\n- MoS Railways Manoj Sinha and BJP leader Sanjeev Balyan are at the site.\n\n- Alternate arrangement is being made for stranded passengers.\n\n-Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik announced ex gratia of Rs 5 lakhs to the next kin of any Odia passengers killed in the incident. He also announced relief of Rs 50,000 for injured.\n\n- Union Minister of Railway Suresh Prabhu announced ex gratia of Rs 3.5 lakh for the next kin, Rs. 50,000 for those seriously injured and Rs. 25, 000 for people with minor injuries.\n\n- Former chief minister of Uttar Pradesh Mulayam Singh Yadav and Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Raman Singh expressed condolences to the grieving kin of the victim.\n\n- President Ram Nath Kovind and Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed condolences to the grieving kin of the victims who lost their lives in the derailment of the Puri-Haridwar-Kalinga Utkal Express.\n\n- Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath said that he has sent two of his ministers to the accident spot to take a stock of the situation.\n\n(This article has not been edited by DNA's editorial team and is auto-generated from an agency feed.)", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "17:07:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T17:07:00Z"}

"body": "[India], Aug. 19 (ANI): The death toll in the deadly Puri-Haridwar-Kalinga Utkal Express derailment has mounted to 23, while the injured are being counted at 40 so far.\n\nHere are the updates in the tragedy so far:\n\n- Fourteen coaches of Puri-Haridwar-Kalinga Utkal Express derailed in Muzaffarnagar's Khatauli area.\n\n- 23 people have lost their lives till now and 40 are said to be injured.\n\n- The incident took place around 5:50 pm.\n\n- Indian Railways released emergency helpline number for detail information.\n\n- Nine Uttar Pradesh Provincial Armed Constabulary (PAC) companies, a team of National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) and Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) have been rushed to the spot.\n\n- Medical vans have also been rushed to the site\n\n- Union Railway Minister Suresh Prabhu said that he has ordered inquiry into the unfortunate accident to ascertain the cause.\n\n- Railway Ministry and Uttar Pradesh Government are working hand in hand, informs Prabhu.\n\n- As per sources repair work was underway at the track.\n\n- MoS Railways Manoj Sinha and BJP leader Sanjeev Balyan are at the site.\n\n- Alternate arrangement is being made for stranded passengers.\n\n-Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik announced ex gratia of Rs 5 lakhs to the next kin of any Odia passengers killed in the incident. He also announced relief of Rs 50,000 for injured.\n\n- Union Minister of Railway Suresh Prabhu announced ex gratia of Rs 3.5 lakh for the next kin, Rs. 50, 000 for those seriously injured and Rs. 25, 000 for people with minor injuries.\n\n-President Ram Nath Kovind and Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday expressed condolences\n\n- Former chief minister of Uttar Pradesh Mulayam Singh Yadav and Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Raman Singh expressed condolences to the grieving kin of the victim.\n\n- Union Health Minister JP Nadda asked central trauma care teams to remain on standby.\n\n- Repair work was underway at the track during derailment, say sources. "body": "Several people have been injured, rescue operation is underway. Picture courtesy Twitter\n\nAt least 18 people were feared killed and over 100 others injured, including women and children, when Haridwar bound Kalinga Utkal Express train derailed in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar district, about 500 kilometres from here, on Saturday.\n\nEye witness accounts claimed that the number of dead was more and said that many people were still trapped inside the badly mangled coaches of the train.\n\nThe number of injured was put at over 100. The death toll could go up as many of the injured since many are said to be in critical condition.\n\nAdditional director general of UP police, law and order, Anand Kumar told reporters that a large number of passengers were injured in the mishap.\n\nUnion minister Sanjiv Baliyan, who hailed from Muzaffarnagar, said that he had seen many dead inside the coaches.\n\nPolice sources said that the mishap occurred near Khatauli railway station, which is 22 kilometres from the district headquarters, around six in the evening. The train was scheduled to reach Haridwar, a pilgrimage town in Uttarakhand around nine in the evening.\n\nSources said that ten coaches of the train, which was on its way to Haridwar in Uttarakhand from Puri in Odisha, derailed near the outer cabin near Khatauli. One of the coaches also rammed into the houses, which were close to the railway tracks.\n\nOfficials said medical teams had reached the spot from Meerut, Saharanpur and other nearby districts. Over 65 ambulances were pressed into service to ferry the injured to the hospital.\n\nThe injured were admitted to the nearby hospitals in Meerut and Muzaffarnagar, the officials said adding that hospitals in the NCR region had been put on alert following the mishap. Some of the injured were stated to be in a critical condition.\n\nThe derailed coaches had climbed on other coaches, making the rescue work difficult. Gas cutters were pressed into service to cut through the mangled coaches to pull out the passengers, who were trapped inside the derailed coaches.\n\nSources said that over 100 passengers were pulled out of the derailed coaches so far. Locals were the first ones to reach the spot and rescue the passengers.\n\nNDRF team had also rushed to the spot to assist in the relief and rescue operations, officials here said.\n\nOfficials here said that the Anti-Terrorist Squad (ATS) team of the UP police had also rushed to the spot to investigate if sabotage was behind the mishap.\n\nSources said that the train was travelling at a high speed when it derailed. "extractedDates": null, "isDuplicate": false, "dateCrawl": "2017-08-19", "body": "The train driver of the Kalinga Utkal Express applied sudden brakes as he spotted repair works on the tracks, leading to the derailment that killed at least 11 people and injured around 60 others, a government official said on Saturday. (LIVE\u2009UPDATES)\n\nUP's principal secretary (home) Arvind Kumar said the accident was caused by the sudden application of brakes. \"There was some work on the tracks, but no flagging was done,\" he told Hindustan Times.\n\nRailway sources, however, told HT that the driver did not apply the brakes. \"He felt a jerk and realised that the derailment had happened. He couldn't apply the brake. According to him either the soil beneath the track was loose due to rains or the railways didn't do periodic ultrasonic fault detection of tracks,\" the source said.\n\nApparently, the engine and five bogies of the train had crossed the spot smoothly when the accident happened.\n\nThe Haridwar-bound Kalinga Utkal Express derailed in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar district on Saturday when the driver applied sudden brakes as some repair work was going on the tracks.\n\nThe Puri-Haridwar train got derailed near Khatauli station at 5:45 pm.\n\nPrime minister Narendra Modi expressed extreme pain over the accident and assured that the railway ministry and state government were doing everything possible to provide the required assistance.\n\nRailway minister Suresh Prabhu ordered an inquiry into the derailment, adding that he was personally monitoring the situation and that strict action would be taken in case of lapses.\n\nBJP MLA from Khatauli, Vikram Singh Saini alleged conspiracy as repair work was on when the train was passing.\n\nSeveral people were reportedly injured but officials confirmed their numbers as 20. The figures are expected to go up.\n\nWitnesses said at least 20 bodies were taken out after cutting iron rods of the train's windows.\n\nRescue work is underway, with teams of the National Disaster Response Force being mobilised to add to the efforts.\n\nRailways have issued helpline numbers: 9760534045/5101 94106 09434, 0121-2604977, 94544 55183, 9410609434, 0121-2604977\n\nRailway minister Suresh Prabhu ordered an inquiry into the derailment and promised strict action in case of lapse. He said he was personally monitoring the situation and said that minister of state Manoj Sinha has rushed to the spot while the Railway Board chairman and member traffic have been asked to oversee rescue and relief operations.\n\nChief minister Yogi Adityanath has ordered free treatment of all the injured. UP ministers Suresh Rana and Satish Mahana have been directed to rush to the site.\n\nSenior administration officials from Meerut and Muzaffarnagar have rushed to the spot.\n\nTo check sabotage theory, additional director general of police (law and order) Anand Kumar rushed a team of anti-terrorist squad under deputy superintendent of police Anoop Singh to the site.\n\nVaranasi-based deputy commandant, NDRF, Devendra Kumar said, \"A team of 44 NDRF personnel equipped with rescue equipment have been rushed to the site from Ghaziabad.\"\n\nSince darkness was impeding rescue operations, the power department have been directed to ensure that there was no shortage of electricity.\n\nUP health minister Siddhharth Nath Singh tweeted that the government has mobilised medical services and instructed chief medical officers of Meerut and Muzaffarnagar to extend all help to the injured.\n\nChief medical officer, Meerut, Dr Rajkumar stated that 26 government ambulances have been sent to the accident site for ferrying injured to hospitals in Meerut.\n\nAdditionally, 20 ambulances of private hospitals have also been rushed to the spot.\n\nDr Rajkumar also informed that all hospitals, including the medical college in Meerut, have been put on high alert.\n\nUnion minister Sanjeev Baliyan has reached spot.", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "17:37:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T17:37:00Z"}

Odia passengers killed in the Puri-Haridwar Utkal Express derailment in Uttar Pradesh.\n\nPatnaik, while expressing concern over the incident, also announced Rs 50,000 for each injured person, a statement from the chief minister's office said.\n\nFourteen coaches of the Utkal Express, which had left Puri on the night of August 17 for Haridwar, derailed at Khatauli in Muzaffarnagar district of Uttar Pradesh this evening, causing deaths and injuries.\n\nAltogether 86 passengers -- 80 in sleeper class and six in AC coach -- had boarded the train at Puri station.\n\nRailway officials in New Delhi said the Uttar Pradesh government has informed the ministry of 12 deaths in the derailment.\n\nPatnaik, who is presently in Delhi, spoke to Railway Minister Suresh Prabhu and sought his assistance for rescue of the passengers and the union minister assured him of all assistance to the affected passengers, the statement said.\n\nPatnaik also directed the chief secretary to remain in touch with the railway authorities. He also asked the state's commerce and transport department to work in coordination with the railways and Uttar Pradesh government to provide help to the injured persons and kin of the deceased passengers.\n\nMeanwhile, relatives of the affected passengers gathered at Bhubaneswar and Cuttack railway stations to enquire about the fate of their kin.\n\nThe East Coast Railway has opened a helpline number 1072 -- to provide information on the accident.", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "16:47:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T16:47:00Z"}

"date": "2017-08-19", "imp": true, "textStart": 9}], "isDuplicate": false, "dateCrawl": "2017-08-19", "body": "[India], August 19 (ANI): Additional Director General Anand Kumar Srivastava confirmed that at least 10 have been killed in the Muzzafarnagar train derailment tragedy, further informing that Anti-terror squad (ATS) has been sent to the spot as precautionary measure.\n\n\"I can't comment about the reason of the tragedy. ATS has been sent there as a precautionary measure on behalf of the UP government. After the railway safety officials come, we will co-operate with them and look for the reason of the accident,\" he told ANI.\n\n\"SSP Muzaffarnagar has confirmed deaths of 10 people and 30 to 40 people are injured. 30 ambulances are there on the spot, more are on the way. We are doing relief and rescue operation on war footing. There's lack of welders and cutters. The railways team, who have those instruments, are reaching the spot,\" he added.\n\nSrivastava further updated about the relief and rescue operation on the spot and said, their primary objective is to have minimum deaths.\n\n\"As of now, the relief operations are in full swing. Our primary objective at this point of time is to content the number of causalities to the extent possible. The injured are taken to hospital and administered treatment. For this, we have pressed into service, the ambulances both the government hospitals and charitable organizations\" he said.\n\nHere are the updates in the incident so far:\n\n- Indian Railways release emergency helpline number for detail information.\n\n- 16 coaches of Puri-Haridwar-Kalinga Utkal Express derailed in Muzaffarnagar's Khatauli area\n\n- The incident took place around 5:50 pm.\n\n- Nine Uttar Pradesh Provincial Armed Constabulary (PAC) companies, a team of National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) and Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) have been rushed to the spot.\n\n- Medical vans have been rushed to the site\n\n- Union Railway Minister Suresh Prabhu said that he has ordered inquiry into the unfortunate accident to ascertain the cause.\n\n- Railway Ministry and Uttar Pradesh Government are working hand in hand, informs Prabhu and UP Chief Minister.\n\n- MoS Railways Manoj Sinha and BJP leader Sanjeev Balyan are at the site.\n\n- Two state ministers Satish Mahana and Suresh Rana are sent to the spot.\n\n- Alternate arrangement is being made for stranded passengers.\n\n-Union Minister of Railway Suresh Prabhu has announced ex gratia of Rs 3.5 lakh for the next kin of those who lost their lives in the Muzaffarnagar train derailment tragedy, Rs. 50 thousand for those whi are seriously injured and Rs. 25 thousand for people with minor injuries.\n\n- Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik announced ex gratia of Rs 5 lakh to the next kin of any Odia passenger killed in the accident and Rs. 50 thousand for the injured.\n\n- President Ramnath Kovind, Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Congress vice president Rahul Gandhi shared there condolences over the incident.\n\n- Samajwadi Party supremo Mulayam Singh Yadav shared grief over the incident and wished for better treatment for the injured.\n\n- Chattisgarh Chief Minister Raman Singh too expressed his grief over the incident and shared his condolence with the families of the deceased. He also hoped for speedy recovery of the injured. (ANI)\n\nSEARCH", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "18:49:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T18:49:00Z"}

Khatauli area injuring several people, some of them critically,\" a local official told Xinhua.\n\n\"Around six coaches of the train derailed from the track and one of the derailed coach hit a house,\" the official said.\n\nFollowing the derailment, locals rushed to the spot to help people trapped in the derailed coaches.\n\n\"The injured were taken to local medical facility,\" the official said.\n\nAuthorities have rushed police teams and disaster response force personnel to the spot to intensify rescue work.\n\nThere are fears some passengers are caught inside mangled coaches. Rescue and relief operations are continuing,\" G S Priyadarshi, a top civil official at the accident site told AFP.\n\nThe Associated Press quoted officials putting the number of injured to at least 81.\n\nTwo of the coaches telescoped into each other, while four others toppled over after going off the track, said Arvind Kumar, a top official in Uttar Pradesh, the state where the derailment occurred.\n\nNeeraj Sharma, a railway spokesman, told the Associated Press that the incident took place near the small town of Khatauli.\n\nThe cause of the derailment was not immediately known, Mr Sharma said.\n\nRailway police and local volunteers helped pull passengers out of the upturned coaches of the Kalinga-Utkal Express, which connects the Hindu holy city of Haridwar with the temple town of Puri, in the eastern state of Orissa.\n\nThe injured were taken to a nearby hospital, where doctors described their condition as stable.\n\nTrain crashes are frequent in India, which has the world's fourth biggest rail network. Poor investment in past decades in the vast network and rising demand means overcrowded trains are running on creaking infrastructure.\n\nSaturday's accident is at least the fourth major passenger train derailment this year and the third in Uttar Pradesh in 2017. statement from the chief minister's office said.\n\nFourteen coaches of the Utkal Express, which had left Puri on the night of August 17 for Haridwar, derailed at Khatauli in Muzaffarnagar district of Uttar Pradesh this evening, causing deaths and injuries.\n\nAltogether 86 passengers -- 80 in sleeper class and six in AC coach -- had boarded the train at Puri station.\n\nRailway officials in New Delhi said the Uttar Pradesh government has informed the ministry of 12 deaths in the derailment.\n\nPatnaik, who is presently in Delhi, spoke to Railway Minister Suresh Prabhu and sought his assistance for rescue of the passengers and the union minister assured him of all assistance to the affected passengers, the statement said.\n\nPatnaik also directed the chief secretary to remain in touch with the railway authorities. "2017-08-19", "title": "23 dead as train derails in Uttar Pradesh", "storyUri": "eng-3374117", "extractedDates": null, "isDuplicate": false, "dateCrawl": "2017-08-19", "body": "Lucknow: Twenty-three people were killed and at least 400 injured after eight bogies of the Kalinga Utkal express derailed at Khatauli, 24 km from the Muzaffarnagar district, on Saturday evening. The train was on its way to Haridwar from Puri, Odisha. The UP DGP office in a press release confirmed the number of deaths and said that two NDRF teams and 65 ambulances were rushed to the site of derailment.\n\nSources said that the railway track was broken at one point which led to the derailment. Eye witnesses said that the train was running at a high speed when the derailment took place at around 5.46 pm. The injured passengers were rushed to a Muzaffarnagar hospital. The impact of the derailment was so strong that one bogie crashed into another, leaving several passengers trapped inside. One bogie also rammed into a house located along the railway track.\n\nGas cutters were used to cut open the bogies and rescue those trapped inside. The locals rushed to help the injured passengers. The NDRF team and additional medical teams also reached the site and senior railway and district officials began the rescue operations. The rescue operations were later hampered due to lack of light after sunset. Ambulances were summoned from Muzaffarnagar and Meerut to ferry the patients to hospitals and all hospitals in the adjoining districts were put on high alert.\n\nUP chief minister Yogi Adityanath directed all officials to ensure proper treatment of the injured passengers. The chief minister directed two ministers, Suresh Khanna and Satish Mahana, to reach the site of derailment and supervise rescue operations. Railway spokesman Anil Saxena said that the priority was to rescue those still trapped inside and prevent loss of life. A team of the UP ATS also left for Muzaffarnagar to probe into the possibility of a sabotage or a terror angle in the case.", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "20:16:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T20:16:00Z"}

"2017-08-19", "freq": 3, "textStart": 45}], "isDuplicate": false, "dateCrawl": "2017-08-19", "body": "By: Express Web Desk | New Delhi | Published:August 19, 2017 10:02 pm Utkal Express derailment: Coaches of the Puri-Haridwar Utkal Express train after it derailed in Khatauli near Muzaffarnagar on Saturday. At least four were killed and 15 to 20 people were said to be injured as per initial reports. (PTI Photo) Amit Shah resigns as MLA, says Congress will be reduced to half in next pollsPro Kabaddi 2017 Live score, UP Yoddha vs Haryana Steelers live score: UP Yoddha 23-17 Haryana Steelers at half-timePro Kabaddi League 2017: Points Table, Team Standings\n\nFourteen coaches of Puri-Haridwar Kalinga Utkal Express derailed in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar area on Saturday evening leaving at least 23 dead and over 60 injured. The derailment occurred at Khatuali region around 5:45 pm. However, the cause for the derailment is yet to be ascertained. Taking a note of the incident, Union Railway Minister Suresh Prabhu said he is personally monitoring the situation and has also directed some senior officials to take stock of the situation, ensuring speedy rescue and relief operations.\n\nPrime Minister expressing grief on the mishap tweeted, \"Extremely pained by the derailment of the Utkal Express in Muzaffarnagar. My thoughts are with the families of the deceased. I wish those injured a speedy recovery. The situation is being monitored very closely by the Railways Ministry. Railways Ministry & UP Government are doing everything possible & providing all assistance required in the wake of the train derailment.\" The President also expressed sadness over the major train derailment that left several injured. He was quoted by news agency ANI as saying: \"Sad at train derailment in UP; my thoughts are with deceased & their families. Injured are being rescued & provided relief.\"\n\nThe injured have been rushed to Khatauli hospital. UP police and the Ministry of Railways looking at the critical situation have released a list of helpline numbers.\n\nMuzaffarnagar authorities set up helpline: 0131-2436918, 0131-2436103 and 0131-2436564\n\n<blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\" data-lang=\"en\"><p lang=\"hi\" dir=\"ltr\"><a href=\"http://twitter.com/hashtag/UtkalExpress?src=hash\">#UtkalExpress</a&gt; \u092e\u0941\u091c\u093c\u092b\u094d\u092b\u0930\u0928\u0917\u0930 \u091f\u094d\u0930\u0947\u0928 \u090f\u0915\u094d\u0938\u0940\u0921\u0947\u0902\u091f \u0939\u0947\u0932\u094d\u092a \u0932\u093e\u0907\u0928 \u0928\u0902\u092c\u0930 <a href=\"http://twitter.com/hashtag/uppolice?src=hash\">#uppolice</a&gt; <a href=\"http://t.co/9OoKSy6a7s\">pic.twitter.com/9OoKSy6a7s</a></p>&mdash; UP POLICE (@Uppolice) <a href=\"http://twitter.com/Uppolice/status/898899275370962944''>August 19, 2017</a></blockquote>\n\n<blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\" data-lang=\"en\"><p lang=\"en\" dir=\"ltr\">Angements of Buses has been done for the clearance of the stranded passengers &amp; for any further detail contact following Helpline no <a href=\"http://t.co/86AirnBLyp\">pic.twitter.com/86AirnBLyp</a></p>&mdash; Ministry of Railways (@RailMinIndia) <a href=\"http://twitter.com/RailMinIndia/status/898934689007779840''>August 19, 2017</a></blockquote>\n\nFor all the latest India News, download Indian Express App", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "16:33:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T16:33:00Z"}

"textEnd": 2328, "date": "2017-04-09", "textStart": 2315}], "isDuplicate": false, "dateCrawl": "2017-08-19", "body": "New Delhi: Train accidents remain a major area of concern in the country despite technological advancements. Though the government has been able to reduce them over the years, deadly mishaps continue to traumatize us.\n\nHere is the list of major train accidents in 2017 compiled by india.com:\n\nAt least 23 people were killed and over 40 others injured when 14 coaches of Puri-Haridwar-Kalinga Express train derailed in Khatauli in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar district.\n\nThe toll was expected to rise as some of the injured were in critical condition.\n\nThe cause of the accident was not immediately known.\n\n2. Meerut-Lucknow Rajya Rani Express derailment, April 15, 2017.\n\nTen people were injured when the express train derailed near Rampur in Uttar Pradesh. The derailment happened near a bridge over the Koshi river.\n\nUP Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath announced Rs 50,000 compensation to those seriously injured and Rs 25,000 to people with minor injuries.\n\n3. Jagdalpur-Bhubaneswar Hirakhand Express derailment, Jan 22, 2017.\n\nTwenty-seven people were killed and 36 others were injured when nine coaches of the express train derailed in Andhra Pradesh's Vizianagaram district.\n\n4. Kalindi Express derailment, Feb 20, 2017.\n\nThe engine and the three coaches of the Delhi-bound Kalindi Express was derailed at the Tundla Junction in Uttar Pradesh. The derailment happened when the train rammed into a freight train from the back.\n\n5. Ujjain train blast, March 3, 2017.\n\nEight people were injured, two of them seriously, in an explosion in the Bhopal-Ujjain passenger train near Jabdi station in Madhya Pradesh. The state government had called it a terrorist attack.\n\n6. Train rams into ambulance in Bengaluru, March 17, 2017.\n\nFour women were killed when a passenger train rammed into an ambulance at an unmanned level crossing at Mannekote-Talaka road in Karnataka's Chitradurga district. The ambulance driver misjudged the speed of the approaching train and tried to cross the unmanned level crossing.\n\n7. Mahakaushal Express derailment, March 30, 2017.\n\nA total of 52 passengers were injured when the Mahakaushal Express derailed in Uttar Pradesh. The train, which runs between Jabalpur in Madhya Pradesh and Hazrat Nizamuddin in Delhi derailed near Kulpahar station.\n\n8. Goods train derailment in West Bengal, April 9, 2017.\n\nThe engine of a goods train derailed between Madpur and Jakpur stations in West Bengal. The derailment had affected train services. However, there was no casualty.\n\nA study carried out by IndiaSpend website had claimed that \"excessive traffic\" and \"underinvestment in rail infrastructure\" were main factors for derailments.", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "17:18:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T17:18:00Z"}

"date": "2017-08-19", "title": "Utkal Express Derailment: At least 23 dead;  trains weren't supposed to speed in recently fixed tracks, says residents", "storyUri": "eng-3374117", "extractedDates": null, "isDuplicate": false, "dateCrawl": "2017-08-19", "body": "Passengers also said that the driver applied emergency brakes after the train was travelling at high speed, which could have resulted in the derailment\n\nAt least twenty-three passengers were killed and over 40 were injured when 12 bogies of the Haridwar-bound 18477 Kalinga Utkal Express (Puri-Haridwar) derailed near Khatauli Railways Station in Muzzafarnagar district of Uttar Pradesh on Saturday evening.\n\nThe incident took place at 5.50 pm, about 200 metres from Khatauli Railway Station on Meerut-Saharapur section. A Railway spokesperson said that their main focus was on rescuing those trapped and rushing the injured to a local hospital.\n\nHowever, before the railways could reach, locals started the rescue operations by helping out trapped passengers. The impact of the accident was so severe that the tracks were uprooted at several places. The impact also resulted in the train's S2 bogey jumping over other bogies and hitting a house near the tracks causing severe damage. Residents of the damaged house managed to escape, as one of the family members witnessed the derailment and called for everyone to run inside.\n\nAn eyewitness told DNA that the tracks had recently been fixed, and new tracks demand trains travel at a desired speed limit to ensure safety. However, trains continued travelling at full speed. \"The tracks were repaired last Saturday and we had requested the railways to put up a board directing the trains to slow down, as our houses were near the tracks. However, they didn't pay heed,\" alleged Ratan Kumar, a local who lives nearby.\n\nPassengers who survived claimed that the driver of the train had applied the emergency break, when the train was travelling at a high speed for some unknown reasons. The SSP Muzffarnagar confirmed deaths of 20 passengers, adding that over 40 were injured. He said that 65 ambulances were pressed to take injured to the hospital. Local administration meanwhile had provided food and water to the stranded passengers and arranged buses to take them to their destination.\n\n\"Only a few passengers remained trapped. Bogies are being cut and they would be pulled out soon,\" the SSP said, adding that the death toll could increase as several people sustained severe injuries.\n\nAlthough officials have not declared whether the attack had a terror angle to it, a team of the Uttar Pradesh Anti-Terrorism squad under SSP Anoop Singh was rushed to Khatauli from Noida to conduct probe. The National Disaster Relief Fund, railway relief team and medical vans were rushed to the spot.\n\nUttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has issued directives to the state home secretary and the director general of police to personally supervise the rescue and relief operations. The Inspector General of Railways has also been rushed to the spot.\n\nWhile speaking to ANI, Adityanath said that he had deputed his cabinet ministers Satish Mahana and Suresh Rana to ensure that the injured received the best possible medical attention, and those rescued have no trouble in reaching their destinations. The Adityanath government also announced a compensation of Rs 2 lakh to families of the deceased, and Rs 50,000 to each of injured.\n\nThe Ministry of Railways also announced that the kin of the deceased will get Rs 3.5 lakh, while those with major injuries would receive Rs 50,000. The accident has resulted in the diversion of two dozen trains. This has affected the Meerut-Shahranpur-Ambala route.", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "17:24:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T17:24:00Z"}

"2017-08-19", "body": "Rescue operations are underway after train derailment in India's northern Uttar Pradesh state kills at least 10 people and injures 150 government officials say. Rough Cut (no reporter narration)\n\nROUGH CUT (NO REPORTER NARRATION) At least 10 people have been killed and 150 people injured after a train derailed in India's northern state of Uttar Pradesh, a government official said on Saturday (August 19). The accident happened in the town of Khatauli whilst the Kalinga-Utkal Express was travelling from the eastern city of Puri to Haridwar city in the north of the country. The local administration is carrying out rescue operations and a team from the National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) have been at the scene. India's state railways, built during British colonial rule, have an appalling safety record after decades of low investment and have prioritised keeping fares low for the 23 million passengers who use the network every day. India recorded 27,581 railway deaths in 2014, the most recent year for which figures are available, with most victims falling from, or being struck by, moving trains.", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "17:12:00", "dateTime": "2017-08-19T17:12:00Z"}

null, "isDuplicate": false, "dateCrawl": "2017-08-19", "body": "The track on which the Kalinga Utkal Express derailed was under repair near Khatauli but there was negligence in conveying the information to the train driver, initial probe into the accident revealed.\n\nRailway officials said at least 15 metres of the track had been taken off and was being replaced when the Puri-Haridwar train appeared.\n\nWith no option left, labourers ran for their lives leaving the equipments and the replacement track, which were later found under coach A-1 of the derailed train.\n\n\"The railway track was found broken underneath the coach A-1 and clamps were lying on other side of the track,\" said a railway official.\n\nAs per the probe, even the Khatauli station staff was not aware that the repair work was still underway.\n\n\"If alert had been sounded, then the Utkal Express would not have reached Khatauli,\" a railway official said.\n\nThe probe is now looking at why no alert was sounded between Meerut and Muzaffarnagar.\n\nUP's principal secretary (home), Arvind Kumar said the derailment was caused by sudden application of brakes by the train driver. \"There was some work on the tracks but no flagging was done,\" he told HT.\n\nPrima facie there was no indication of sabotage, Kumar added.", "eventUri": "eng-3374117", "timeCrawl": "19:28:00", "dateTime": in the Utkal Express derailment near Khatauli in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar district on Saturday, the train accident points to systemic flaws within the Indian Railways.\n\nAccording to a report submitted by the Standing Committee on Railways to Lok Sabha in December 2016, it was found that derailments were the leading cause of train accidents in India between 2003 and 2016. It further showed that the leading reason behind these accidents was failures on part of the railway staff. Most instances were those of carelessness, adoption of shortcuts and non-observance of safety rules and guidelines. "http://www.livemint.com/Politics/fYPOLSrWJ2jXGC8JZlkgKO/Utkal-Express-derailment-Trains-on-Meerut-line-cancelled-or.html", "body": "Muzaffarnagar: Trains passing through the Meerut line of the Northern Railway have been either cancelled or diverted till 6pm Sunday, in the wake of the tragic accident at Khatauli in Uttar Pradesh, a senior railway official said.\n\nThe sleepy town of Khatauli, about 100 kms from Delhi, became the epicentre of rescue operations yesterday after 13 bogies of the Puri-Haridwar Kalinga Utkal Express derailed near its station, killing at least 22 people. \"All services on Meerut line, on which the Khatauli falls, have been either cancelled or diverted through other routes till 6pm, as the tracks are yet to be cleared of mangled train coaches,\" DRM of the Delhi Division, R N Singh said.\n\nDelhi Division falls under the Northern Railway Zone, which administers some of the busiest stations in the country. \"The train had 23 coaches out of which 13 had derailed. It was running at a speed of about 100 kmph when the accident took place,\" he said. Singh said the diverted trains would run through Shamli till the restoration work is over.\n\nThe train was coming from Puri in Odisha and going to Haridwar in Uttarakhand, normally a journey of about 36 hours. The train suffered huge damage in the accident last evening at Khatauli, around 40 km from Muzaffarnagar, which Singh described as \"very grave\". The derailment had such a massive impact that the train's one of the sleeper coaches climbed onto another, while its other end rammed into a house, shattering its facade, and leaving its occupants terrified. Two of the sleeper coaches overturned, with one of them hitting the facade of a local college.\n\nAlso Read: 23 dead after 14 coaches of Utkal Express derail near Muzaffarnagar in UP\n\nBodies of two men and as many women were pulled out by the NDRF team, which worked from nearly 9pm last night till 3am, to rescue survivors or extricate bodies with due dignity. Asked about the allegation made by several locals and some passengers that \"maintenance work\" was underway when the accident happened, the DRM said, \"It was just some routine work. And, the railway minister has already ordered an inquiry. So, let the report come, I cannot say, anything more on that.\" The injured have been taken to hospitals in Muzaffarnagar and Meerut and both the railway and the local administration has issued helplines.
